loans.name: Cristian Joel

texts.es:
Cristian, vive con sus padres, se dedica a prestar servicios con un taxi, tiene dos años en el negocio, su padre le compro el taxi, para que mantuviera una ocupación y pudiera generar ingresos.
Él está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita reparar el sistema eléctrico del vehículo y tapizar los asientos,  por eso recurre al préstamo para que pueda cubrir el gasto y mejorar las condiciones de vehículo,  ya que esto tambien le dará mejor vistosidad para los clientes, que viajen con comodidad, además estará más seguro del sistema de electricidad. 
La aspiración de Cristian es brindar un buen servicio en su taxi, con el préstamo espera tener la posibilidad económica para pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
Cristian lives with his parents and has a taxi business that he has been in for two years.  His father bought him the taxi so he would have work and could generate an income.

He must repair his vehicle's electric system and reupholster the seats and therefore has requested a loan to cover the expense so he can improve the vehicle's condition.  This will also make it more inviting for customers who will travel more comfortably and be safer with the electric system.

Cristian wants to offer a good taxi service and is intent on paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle's electric system and reupholster the seats.

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
Jorge, vive en casa propia, con su madre y dos hermanas de 14 y 20 años de edad, él es agricultor, dedicado desde hace dos años a las siembras agrícolas, actualmente está iniciando junto a su padre el cultivo de maíz, por esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los insumos como abono, herbicidas, para aplicarlos a la siembra.
Con la ayuda de este préstamo, obtendrá lo necesario para sacar una buena cosecha, mejorando económicamente con ventas para ayudarles a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in his own house with his mother and two sisters, ages 14 and 20.  He is a farmer and has been growing crops for two years .  Now he is beginning to plant corn with his father and is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as compost and herbicides for the crop.

With the help of the loan he will be able to obtain what he needs for a good harvest, meaning he will improve sales and be able to help his parents economically.

loans.use: To buy compost and herbicides for his crop.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  vit dans une des communautés sénégalaises. Elle est mariée et  âgée de 51 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 25 ans dans le commerce de couscous, de glace  et de crème. Grâce a ses revenus elle parvient a subvenir a ses besoins  et a soutenir sa famille. Elle est  membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation  depuis septembre 2000 et a déjà remboursé 14 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un stock de produits locaux( mil)  qui lui permettent de préparer le couscous qu’elle commercialise. Les bénéfices qu’elle tire de ses opérations de vente lui ont permis d’équiper sa maison en mobiliers, d’acquérir un terrain et d’aider sa sœur a acheter une place au marché de leur localité.
texts.en:
Aissatou lives in one of the communities in Senegal. She is 51 years old and married. She has been selling couscous, ice and cream for over 25 years. Her income allows her to take care of her needs and support her family.

Aissatou has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch since September 2000 and has already repaid 14 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs so that she can buy locally-grown millet, which she uses to make the couscous she sells.

The profits that she earns through her business activities have allowed her to furnish her home, buy property and help her sister with the acquisition of a spot in their local market.

loans.use: to buy millet with which to make couscous.

loans.name: Gema Katherine

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Gema, tiene 20 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  una niña de 4 años que es su razón de vivir. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Ella es una joven madre que para que a sus pequeña no le falte nada se dedica a varias actividades, trabaja en la ciudad de Manta en una distribuidora de artículos tanto personales como para el hogar, como tiene la facilidad de comprar a mejor precio en este lugar empezó también su propio negocio, vende estos artículos en su casa un pequeño local que instalo, su mamá le ayuda en su local los momentos que ella está trabajando. Lleva ya cerca de un año con su negocio y que le está yendo muy bien, lo que más vende son bisutería y cositas para fiestas infantiles.

Este crédito es para comprar bisutería, globos, piñatas, adornos para fiestas y ciertos artículos para Carnaval.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia distribuidora.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ángel Gabriel" meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, both nationally and internationlly.  It is also famous for the "Panama" straw hat.

Here we meet Gema, 20, who is a single mother of a 4-year-old daughter who is her reason for living.  She lives with her parents and has been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes the easy loan terms.

As a young mother she is involved in various activities to make sure her daughter has everything she needs.  Gema works in the city of Manta for a distributor of personal and household products.  Since she can buy products at a good price she set up her own business and sells them from a small stall in her home.  Her mother helps out working the stall when Gema is working elsewhere.  She has been in business for a year and it is going well for her.  Her best-selling products are costume jewelry and carnival items.

This loan will be used to buy costume jewelry, balloons, piñatas, party decorations and some carnival items.

Her dream is to become her own distributor.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry, balloons, piñatas, party decorations and carnival tems.

loans.name: Mario Heriberto

texts.es:
Mario, es agricultor y además tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo, solamente él trabaja en su hogar, aprendió la agricultura de su padre, el negocio del taller lo inicio hace varios años, tiene experiencia para manejar su trabajo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, semilla, tambien comprara materiales como hierro, lámina, electrodos, para el taller, esta compra le ayudara para poder realizar sus actividades.
La aspiración de Mario es mejorar su capacidad en el taller, tener buenas cosechas, y aportar para su familia lo necesario para las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Mario is a farmer who also has a metal structure workshop.  He lives with his wife and son and is the only bread-winner.  He learned farming from his father and set up his workshop several years ago so has gained ample experience.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as compost, herbicides and seeds, and also materials such as iron, sheet metal, and electrodes for his workshop.  This purchase will help him carry out his work activities.

Mario aims to increase his workshop's capacity, have a good harvest, and provide his family with all the basic needs.

loans.use: To buy compost, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, solamente él trabaja, inicio desde joven la agricultura, ayudando a su padre, trabaja en tierras alquiladas, no tiene un horario establecido para atender sus ocupaciones. Él como inicio de sus actividades agrícolas, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los materiales necesarios como el abono, insecticidas, semilla; con esto podrá tener la certeza de iniciar bien su trabajo.
La aspiración de José es mejorar las cosechas para tener buenos ingresos de las ventas que genera, ya que al tener abundante cosecha le permite ofrecer a los clientes.
texts.en:
José is a farmer and lives with his wife.  They have no children.  He is the only bread-winner and began farming at a very young age helping his father.  He works on rented land and has no fixed work schedule.  Since he is just beginning his farm activity he is requesting a loan to buy needed materials such as compost, insectides and seeds.  This will assure him that he is beginning his work well.

José's goal is to have a good harvest and an abundant crop to sell to customers, which will generate a nice income.

loans.use: To buy compost, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Wakeur Anta Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " Wakeur Anta" est constitué de trois femmes mariées et de deux jeunes filles.Elles exercent dans le commerce de tissus et de produits ménagers divers.Elles achètent en gros et se partagent les produits en fonction de la part de chacune dans le capital de départ.Elles parviennent à obtenir des bénéfices qu'elles investissent pour l'essentiel dans des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives et dans la satisfaction de leurs besoins propres.Le chef du groupe ( en jaune au milieu), est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois sont à l'école.Elles vend depuis cinq ans des tissus au marché central.Les revenus générés par son commerce lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des rouleaux de tissus et de produits ménagers divers.Leur ambition est de renforcer leur commerce.
texts.en:
The "Wakeur Anta" group is composed of 3 married women and 2 young women. They sell fabrics and assorted household products. They buy their products wholesale and share them amongst each other according to their initial capital stake. They manage to make a profit which they mostly spend on covering their families´ living expenses and taking care of their own needs.

The group´s leader (in the middle of the picture, wearing yellow) is the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. For the past 5 years, she has been selling fabrics at the central market. The income she earns from her sales allows her to take care of her needs and those of her children.

The group is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs in order to increase their business funds, so that they can buy some rolls of fabric and diverse household products. Their aim is to strengthen their business.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and diverse household products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and married with one child. She resides at Digson, Bonifacio, Misamis Ciidental: Philippines. Norma owns and operates farmland, where she plants and harvests corn for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business 11 years. 

Each month, Norma earns PHP 7,000 with her farm. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Norma hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él es agricultor, aprendió desde joven como mozo, luego inicio realizando sus propias siembras, trabaja en tierras alquiladas, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, para el cultivo de maíz en dos manzanas de terreno, este préstamo le permitirá mejorar manteniendo los insumos necesarios para realizar la siembra.
Su aspiración  es obtener una buena cosecha, de la cual pueda vender para generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer, and learned this as a boy. Later he started planting his own crops. He works on rented land and has no set schedule.  

He is asking for a loan to buy farming materials such as fertilizer and herbicides for his corn crop on two lots of land. This loan will allow him to improve with the necessary materials for the crop. 

He aspires to having a good crop that he can sell to generate income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for planting.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
This is Cristy, who is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She 57 years old and is married to Merwin, a skilled carpenter. She has two children, one in high school and the youngest not yet of school age. 

 Cristy is in the garment business. She keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in managing their daily expenses. She buys textiles and fabrics from the factories, cut it into pieces and sews it. She sells in the market and neighborhood. There are also clients who go to her house to purchase clothes in bulk. Some companies also look for her in sewing their office uniforms. She ventured into a rug making business since she still has a lot of scrap textiles that can be sewn into rugs.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more textiles and fabrics for her garment business. She believes that having extra stock of textiles will help her to sew more dresses and will result in a greater profit due to more sales. Her customers will definitely appreciate the availability of her items. This will enable her to save more for their older years ahead. 

Cristy hopes that her business will grow and last.  She hopes that she can have more clients. She wants her children to finish their studies and have a good life ahead. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God inspires her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Afellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for textiles needed in her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married and has four children.  Josefina is 49 years old and resides at Garang, Tangub City: Philippines.  Josefina owns and operate a nipa-making (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) business to earn a living and she has been in this business for 5 years. 

Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase additional nipa hut to weave.  In 2009, Josefina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Josefina  wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional nipa hut to weave.

loans.name: Juana Lourdes

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo amorosa, ya que tiene 2 hijos y a pesar que ellos tienen 22 y 24 años ella los engríe, es madre soltera y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos sola, pero ella nos comenta que para ella ha sido un reto y sobre todo que se siente orgullosa porque sus hijos están estudiando en la universidad. Juana estudio enfermería técnica, ella nos comenta que le gusto estudiar enfermería porque le nace el atender va los enfermos; Juana como buena peruana le gusto mucho nuestra comida y uno de sus platillos favoritos es la “Parrillada de Carne”.

Juana con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro pudo formar su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  de damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy alegre y carismática y que eso le brinda confianza a los clientes además de ofrecer productos de calidad.

Juana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería (ropa de verano) para poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, con ello tendra mayores ingresos y podra seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su mas grande sueño:”Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Juana is a hardworking woman who is very loving. She has 2 children. Although they are 22 and 24, she is a single mother and has gotten her children ahead alone. She tell us that it has been a challenge and she is proud because her children are in college.  Juana studied to be a licensed practical nurse. She tells us she likes nursing because it is in her nature to want to care for sick people. Juana, as a good Peruvian, really loves our cuisine and one of her favorite dishes is “Parrillada de Carne” [Grilled Meat].

With a lot of hard work and above all, savings, Juana was able to start her own business. She sells women's, men's and children's clothing. She works for about 10 hours a day and can serve about 15 customers a day. She believes that it is going well in her business because she is very cheerful and charismatic and this inspires trust in her customers. She also offers quality products.  

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will able to buy more merchandise (summer clothing) to have more products to offer her customers. With this, she will have more income and be able to keep saving to achieve her biggest dream: giving her children professional careers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (summer clothing)

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou, marié et père de famille est un marchand depuis dix ans. Son activité consiste à vendre du matériel de construction .Avec une clientèle de jour en jour grandissante et élargie, Abdou commence à  faire des livraisons éloignées. Pour pallier à cela, il a besoin d’un moyen de déplacement.
Le prêt va donc lui servir à compléter pour acquérir une fourgonnette .Il a déjà trois millions en poche et il lui reste à compléter les cinq cent mille.
Abdou est chef de famille et la dépense quotidienne est à sa charge.
Dans l’ avenir Abdou voudrai devenir un grand commerçant
texts.en:
Abdou is married and a father, and has been a trader for 10 years. He sells construction materials. With a customer base that´s growing and expanding from day to day, Abdou is starting to make long-distance deliveries. In order to be able to do this, he needs a means of transportation.

This loan will enable him to complete a deal to buy a delivery van. He already has 3 million francs and needs a further 500 000 to complete the deal. Abdou is the head of the family and responsible for covering their daily expenses. In the future, he would like to become an important retailer.

loans.use: to complete a deal to buy a delivery van to use to transport materials.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 41 years old, is a taxi driver in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been running this for a year and already has many customers.  

He lives with his wife and his son in an old wooden house which was built in the early 1990’s.  His family has been living in this house for many years.  However it is becoming very old and needs to be renovated urgently.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations to his old house.  It will be a big improvment to his family’s living condition, he hopes.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations to his old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is from Maloro, Tangub City.  She is 49 years old and is married. 

To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community.  Elsie has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elsie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  In 2011, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Tumentogtoh

texts.en:
Tumentogtoh is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in the northern part of the country.  The children study at the local high school. Her husband works in the intercity transport and delivers packages.  

She has been running clothes retailing business in the market counter since 2008.  For the national holiday, she would like to trade more goods by having a larger amount of supplies.  It's a profitable business during the festival as people present different kinds of presents to each other.  She is a large-minded woman who says that "I would like to raise my income this year with the support".  The total amount she is requesting is 4,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes for the upcoming Tsagaan sar, a Mongolian national holiday.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice and flour.

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en:
Tsetsegee is a young lady who lives with her parents in southern Mongolia.  Her father works for a private company and her mother is unemployed.  

She started a vegetable retailing business in 2011.  She buys the supplies from Erlian city, China.  Now her plan is to trade some fruits by importing them from China so that she can expand the business and make the counter bigger.  As she has many regular customers, the business would be beneficial.  She is an independent woman who says that "I would like to increase the products types with the financial assistance".  The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT for the more fruits.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is married with three children. Dioscora is forty-eight-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Dioscora is managing a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for twenty years and every month she earns 10,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2008, Dioscora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Dioscora hopes to save to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Munhdelger

texts.en:
Munhdelger is forty-seven years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a employed and her daughter is a college student. She started her traditional clothes sewing business in 2000. She started her business with only a sewing machine now she has her own counter and employs a salesperson. 

Now that Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her product demand is increasing, therefore she needs more supplies. She's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy silk and material. She is a sharp and hardworking women who says "Now that my daughter is in college, I have to work even harder to support her."

loans.use: To buy silk and material.

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en:
Delgermaa is a thirty-nine-year-old lady who lives with her family in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. For the past eight years, she has supported her family by operating a small grocery store business. 

When she first began her business she had a working capital of 500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). Since then she improved her business and now she has a working capital of 1,700,000 MNT. Degermaa’s daily income is about 100,000-120,000 MNT. Furthermore she plans to enlarge her business activity. 

Thus, Delgermaa is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of food products to sell and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en:
Norovsuren is forty-one years old and lives with her two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her two kids are school students. Her husband died last year. She started the business with her husband in 2002. Even though her husband died, she is perfectly able to run her business on her own. Her products are of high quality and fairly affordable. 

Now that Mongolia's biggest festival is approaching, her product demand is increasing. Therefore she's requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy clothes. She is a hardworking woman who says "My kids will go to a college soon. I have to work hard in order to support them".

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene is 28 years old and lives with his wife and a 5 year old daughter in northern Mongolia.  His wife works as a teacher at the local kindergarden. 

He has been running intercity transport business since 2000.  During these times, he found a new business idea to start meat retailing.  He did enough research about the new business.  He is going to sell them at the well positioned shop counter in the area.  He is a really intelligent guy who says that "I would like to start this business with the financial help so that I can save money for my family and I have a plan to live happily with my family". The total amount he is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to purchase livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is from Pangabuan, Tangub City.  At her age of 56, she is still single. 

To make a living, Petronila is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community.  Petronila has been in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Petronila is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering.  In 2010, Petronila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product offering.

loans.name: Delgersaihan

texts.en:
Delgersaihan is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.  His wife helps with his business and his son is a kindergarden student.  He started his garment retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in market.  Even though he is fairly new to the business, he has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. 

His products are fashionable and of high quality.  Now that Mongolia's biggest festival is approaching, his demands are increasing.   Therefore, he thinks that this would be his chance to gain more customers.  He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes from Erlian.  He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "My current income is not quite enough to support my family.  I think this would be my opportunity to increase my income"

loans.use: To buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.name: Johnah

texts.en:
Johnah is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Johnah is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Johnah is running a general store, selling a variety of food and used products for the home in the local community. Johnah has been in her business for 3 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Johnah is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Johnah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is fifty-seven years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband and son work as a construction workers. She started her sewing business in 2000. She mostly sews Mongolian traditional clothes. Her clothes are beautifully made and of high quality. 

Now that holiday season is approaching, she got many orders. She is lacking raw materials to do the job therefore she is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Puntsagdash

texts.en:
Puntsagdash is fifty-one years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is sick and stays at home, and his son is a college student. 

He started his taxi service business in 2010 with his own car. He has many regular customers. He is well known for his excellent service. His car broke down and he is not able to run his business. He needs 400,000 MNT to buy spare parts and to service the car. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Since, I am the only one with the income in my family, it has been terrible since my car broke down".

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en:
Tsetsegee is forty-five years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her son is a high school student. Her husband travels through rural areas and buys fresh diary products and she sells them at her counter in the market. She is well known for her high quality and fresh products. 

Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her demand is increasing. Therefore she's requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy more dairy products from herders. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "soon my boy is going to be a college student and I need to work even harder in order to support him".

loans.use: To buy more dairy products from herders.

loans.name: Isatu A.

texts.en: Pictured above is Isatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu has served in the teaching profession for twenty-six years now. She is married to a police officer and the couple has two children: one is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school. Isatu has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children. And at the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children.

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband and a son in southern Mongolia. Her husband is retired from the army and and a son studies at the secondary school. She has been running her food cart business since 2002.  Based on her business experience and research about the local market, she would like to start a mini shop business near to her home. In order to do this, she needs financial assistance to buy the construction materials for the building and to buy the supplies. She is a wise woman who says that "I would like to run the business so that my family income would increase and we could save for our son's college fees."The total amount she is requesting is 600,000 MNT for the construction materials and to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and meat

loans.name: Gbassay M.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you Gbassay, a primary school teacher in Makeni. Thirty-six year old Gbassay was born in Mamanso village, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has one child who is attending primary school. Gbassay has served in the teaching profession for seven years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to pay his own college fees. He will use the rest of the loan to buy house-building materials – iron corrugated zincs, nails, cements, rods, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay college fees for himself and use the rest of the loan to buy house building materials.

loans.name: Martin I.

texts.en: In the photo above is Martin. Martin is a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. The thirty-four year old has served in the teaching profession for nine years now. A native of Makeni city, Martin is married to a student. Martin is pursuing further studies in college. He has requested this loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to to pay his own college fees .

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, fifty-seven, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single parent to her five children three of whom are now working, one who is currently in college and the youngest who is in high school. While attending to her family's needs, she also kept herself busy with her business as her way of helping his family in sustaining their daily expenses.

Alicia owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries which will enable her to have more stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit. It will help her to save more money for any possible expenditure ahead. 

Alicia hopes that her business will continue to grow. She hopes that she can add more stores in order to have a better income. She wants her house to be renovated and is hoping to have some space to rent.  She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. Sharing the word of God strengthens her faith.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly, thirty-eight, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Roy, a family driver, and is the mother of two children, both of whom are still toddlers. While attending to her husband and kids, she also keeps herself busy with her business which is her way of helping her husband to provide for the family's daily expenses. 

Merly owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar; primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her husband’s foam-selling business is also a big help. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items which will enable her to have more stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit. It will help her to save some money for any unexpected expenses.  

Merly hopes that her business will continue to grow. She hopes that she will be able to send all her children to private school once they are old enough to study. She wants them to enjoy a good life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, fifty-two, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Gerry, a carpenter, and is the mother of two children. The eldest is now working and the youngest is in high school. While attending to her husband and kids, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining the family's daily expenses.

Juanita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar; primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She’s also involved in buying and selling charcoal as an additional source of income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 850 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items which wil enable her to have more stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit. It will help her to save more money for any possible expenditure ahead. 

Juanita hopes that her business will continue to grow. She hopes that she will be able to continue sending all her children to school and that they will be able to finish their studies. She wants to enjoy a comfortable life with her family. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Afellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, fifty-five, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single parent to her four children, three of whom are now working while the youngest is in high school. While attending to the needs of her family, she also keeps herself busy by looking after her business. Her income helps them with their daily expenses. 

Rosita is involved in the food vending business. She buys raw vegetables and meat in the market and cooks different dishes which she sells in the market. She also accepts orders from canteens and school offices. There are also food vendors who come to her house and buy trays of native cakes.  Her regular customers are her neighborhood and passers-by in her community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loans. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw ingredients in order to make more varieties of cooked dishes for her customers to choose. She believes that she will gain increased income and have better profits. She saves the profit for emergencies and the educational expenses of her children. 

Rosita hopes that her business will last and continue to help her in sustaining her family's needs. She dreams of having her own restaurant someday. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as she enjoys sharing God’s love and provision in her life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39-year-old businessman, and he is married to Grace, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past three years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to service the motorbike. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi car.

loans.use: To service the motorbike.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is fifty-two years old, married and a mother of three children. She operates a livestock farm in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last twenty years. She earns a monthly profit of KES 25,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her fifth loan of KES 100,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase more livestock for sale. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, Kabibi hopes to grow her farming business and practice mixed farming.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks, feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Eusebia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Eusebia tiene 30 años, es conviviente y junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos a los cuales adora mucho sobre todo porque tienen 3 y 2 años y aun son muy delicados, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, además de su agricultura en especial por la cosecha de Uva, espárragos, pallares, los cuales han generado muchos puestos de trabajo ya que actualmente se exportan hacia los distintos países del mundo; así como también por ser la cuna del licor bandera de nuestro país que es el “Pisco”. El Perú es muy conocido por su gastronomía, por ello uno de los paltos favoritos de Eusebia el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de los padres de Eusebia, ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Contabilidad. 

Eusebia con mucho esfuerzo ha podido formar su negocio de cabinas de internet, atiende alrededor de 15 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 80 clientes en el dia, ella nos comenta que se levanta muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y poder atender sin contratiempos su negocio; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece un buen servicio a sus clientes y porque es carismática en la atención.

Eusebia agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar una impresora nueva y reparar algunas computadoras que están malogradas; con esta mejora podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio con computadoras en buen funcionamiento así como también realizar impresiones de trabajos, así podrá tener mayores ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 30, and her partner have 2 children.  She loves her children--3- and 2-years old, respectively--and, at their young age, they still very much need their mother.  They live in Ica, a city known for having a mild climate, no matter the season.  Agriculture is a major employer here and local farmers export their crops to all parts of the world.  Grapes, asparagus and butter beans are especially common crops.  The area is also famous for Peru’s flagship drink, “pisco”.   Peru is famous for its cuisine and one of Eusebia’s favorite dishes is “arroz con pollo”.  

Eusebia says that she would have liked to study accounting, but she had to leave school early because her parents couldn’t afford her school fees.  Even so, she has managed to build her own business, selling computer and internet services.  She works 15 hours a day and sees up to 80 customers a day.  She gets up very early to do housework so that she can put in a full day at her store.  The business is successful, she says, because she provides a good service.  

Eusebia is very grateful to Kiva lenders and she will use this loan to buy a new printer and repair the equipment she has.  The investment will allow her to improve her service—by selling printed copies, for example—and, in turn, her income.  She plans to save the extra income to fulfill her dream: “To grow my business”.

loans.use: to pay for equipment repair and buy a new printer for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 28 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with two children between 4 to 9 years old. They are in school and live at home.  For the past four years Janet has been selling bath soap, toothpaste and used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bath soap, toothpaste and used clothes for her business. Her plan is to attend university.

loans.use: to purchase more bath soap, toothpaste, and used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a fifty-year-old married man and the father of two children. In 1983 Mahmoud opened a grocery store in his village to serve his villagers with most of their needs. He has 30 years of experience in this domain. Mahmoud is a hardworking man with an excellent reputation. His shop is filled with many different things attractive enough for customers to buy even though they don't need them at the moment. In addition to food, candies & sweets, Mahmoud sells children toys, and that's why he needs a variety of items that can catch children's attention.

To do so, Mahmoud applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes his future loans will be invested in expanding his business more and more. Mahmoud might use part of the loan in helping his son do necessary sanitary work in his future house.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with new seasonal products.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman is still running his clothes trading business and thus keeps his family. His first Kiva loan was spent to buy a clothes assortment to resell. Now he needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy spring sweaters and trousers for his business.

loans.use: to buy spring sweaters and trousers for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and married to Bernard. Together they have four children, aged 24, 22, 18 and 13 years old. She sells secondhand clothes and she has been in the business for the past 21 years. She gets a monthly income of about KES 15,000 from her business.

This is her first term loan with KADET. She will use the loan amount to purchase secondhand clothes for stock in her business. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to add a stock of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the business by purchasing more stock to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Dye

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 49 años pero él se considera un joven de 20, el vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad ciudad muy activa, debido a la afluencia de turistas que visitan a diario las milenarias Líneas de Nazca, y también por y también por el desarrollo en auge minero, agrícola y comercial de la zona, que la están convirtiendo en unas de las ciudades más cosmopolitas del sur peruano; Francisco en sus tiempos libres le gusta leer, ya que de esta manera se distrae de los problemas y sobre todo lo apacigua cuando está molesto, uno de los platillo que más le gusta a Francisco es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”, es más nos comenta que comería este riquísimo plato todos los días. Francisco estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria; pero debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres, le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar artes plásticas ya que desde pequeño siempre se intereso en ello.

Francisco es muy trabajador, el se dedica a la producción y venta de cerámicos, el trabaja alrededor de 7horas diarias y atiende hasta 15 clientes al día; a él le gusta mucho su trabajo y sobre todo que tiene mucha creatividad, creatividad que según Francisco hace que sus clientes siempre lo busquen para comprar sus productos; en ocasiones francisco trabaja en el campo.

Francisco está agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar los materiales que necesita para ampliar su producción de cerámicos, lo que le permitirá aumentar su ventas ya que tendrá más productos que ofrecer, con esta mejora el tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá ahorrar para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su local propio y tener un mejor taller”.
texts.en:
Francisco is 49-years old, but says he feels like a boy of 20-years.   He lives in Nazca, a city that has become prosperous thanks to the many tourists who come here to see the famous Nazca Lines geolyphs.   Agriculture and mining are also important industries here and Nazca has become one of southern Peru’s most cosmopolitan cities.  Francisco likes to read in his spare time because reading distracts him from his problems and soothes him when he’s troubled.  His favorite dish is “aji de gallina” and he tells us that he would eat it every day if he could.

Francisco says that he would have liked to study art, something that’s always interested him, but he had to leave school early because his parents couldn’t afford the school fees.  Even so, he has managed to build a business making and selling ceramics.  He works 7 hours a day and sees up to 15 customers a day.  He likes the work very much because it requires that he be creative.  The business is successful, he says, because he is creative and his customers seek him out for it.  

Francisco is very grateful to Kiva lenders and says that he will use this loan to buy the materials he needs to make ceramics.  The investment will allow him to grow his business and, in turn, his income.  He plans to save what he can to fulfill his dream: “To build a larger, better workshop where I can sell what I make”.

loans.use: to buy materials for his crafts business.

loans.name: Felacia

texts.en: Felacia is 42 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with three children between 16 and 27 years old. All of them are in school and live at home.  For the past ten years she has been selling rice, oil and vita. She started this business with money given to her by her brother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, vita and rice for her business. In future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, vita and rice for her business

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.es:
Ernesto, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad, él es agricultor, aprendió este oficio por su padre, desde muy joven inicio a sembrar maíz, y hoy en día esta actividad le ha ayudado para velar por las necesidades de sus hijos. 
Él está iniciando por el momento un nuevo cultivo para el que solicita un préstamo, invertirlo en insumos como abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, con estos materiales iniciara correctamente el proceso de la siembra, con la esperanza de tener buenos resultados.
El objetivo de Ernesto es obtener una buena cosecha producto de la aplicación de los insumos y de su esfuerzo, además quiere ser un buen cliente para seguir manteniendo alianzas con la institución.
texts.en:
Ernesto lives with his wife and 3-year old son.  He learned farming from his father as a boy and now he has a farm of his own.  He grows maize and the income from the farm allows him to provide for his own son.
Ernesto is applying for a loan to buy the supplies he needs for his next crop.  He will use the loan to buy manure, herbicides, seed, etc., all the supplies that he needs to run his business and ensure a good result.
Ernesto says that your loans and his own efforts will help him meet his goal of bringing in a good crop.  He says, too, that he wants to build and strengthen his ties with the bank.

loans.use: to buys supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two heifers for raise for dairy cows.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and married. He and his wife have four children, who are all in primary school.

Joseph has had a hotel business for the past two years. He is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy sugar and cooking ingredients to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his hotel business to enable him make enough profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Martha G.

texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has six children between the ages of 13 and 37. Two of her children are working and living on their own while the rest live at home and attend school.

For the past five years, Martha has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business has enabled her to save more money.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 47 years old and he is from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married and has four children who are all in primary school.

Stephen is a farmer and has been doing this for many years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy farm inputs, seeds, fertilizers, etc. to add to his stock.

In the future, Stephen hopes to boost his farming business and venture into cattle rearing.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, fertilizers, etc. to add to his stock.

loans.name: Ricardo Ivan

texts.es:
Ricardo, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 2 años de edad y 7 meses, la ocupación de Ricardo es la elaboración y venta de pizzas, pan con ajo y palitroques, este oficio lo aprendió con estudios, son productos artesanales ósea hechos en casa, lo realiza desde hace 3 años, trabaja desde las 4:00am hasta las 4:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un horno para la cocción de las pizzas, ayudándole este préstamo a tener mayor capacidad con un nuevo horno le permita producir más y mejorar su servicio a la clientela.
El objetivo de él es crecer en el negocio, ganar mayor reconocimiento y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his wife and their two children, 2-years and 7-months old, respectively.  He operates a business making and selling pizzas, garlic bread and "palitroques".  He learned the business after taking a course and makes everything at home.  He started the business 3 years ago and works from 4:00am to 4:00pm.
Ricardo is applying for a loan to buy a new pizza oven.  The investment will allow him to increase his production and improve the service he provides to his customers.
Ricardo wants to grow his business so that he can increase his income and provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a pizza oven for his food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more green maize, tomatoes and bananas for her grocery store.

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es:
Raúl, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, administra un puesto comida rápida, dicho negocio tiene 12 años, tiene los electrodomésticos necesarios para realizar las ventas, lo inicio por la necesidad de tener una ocupación para ganar dinero.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para elaborar tacos, tortas, como las tortillas, pan, carnes, verduras, condimentos, con esta compra mejorara el negocio, dándole mayor auge a sus ventas.
El objetivo de Raúl con el préstamo, es encontrar la manera de mantenerse estable, para atender la demanda, porque de su negocio depende la familia.
texts.en:
Raul lives with his wife and four children.  He operates a food stall where he sells prepared foods.  He started the business 12 years ago and he has all of the equipment that he needs to run it.  He started the business, he says, because he needed a way to make a living.
Raul is applying for a loan to buy the supplies he needs--tortillas, bread, meat, vegetables, condiments, etc.--to make the food he sells.  The investment will help him improve his business and increase his sales.
Raul's family depends on the business and his goal is to build a steady income from it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel, es comerciante de ropa, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a vender ropa nueva y calzado, lo realiza todos los días jueves, sábado y domingo, junto a su esposa, de forma ambulante por los lugares cercanos.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa: blusas, ropa interior y otros artículos como mochilas, para la temporada escolar, este préstamo le permitirá aumentar su disponibilidad en el inventario, con mejores posibilidades de venta.
La aspiración de Leonel es convertirse en un microempresario, con un puesto estable para reducir el riesgo que corren él y su esposa por salir a vender a lugares fuera de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Leonel is a clothes salesman.  He lives together with his wife and two children.  His business is selling new clothing and footwear.  He works every Thursday, Saturday and Sunday, together with his wife, making his sales as an itinerant vendor in nearby places.

Leonel is requesting a loan to buy clothes: blouses, underwear and other items such as backpacks, for the back-to-school season.  This loan will allow him to increase his stock and enjoy better sales possibilities.

Leonel's aspiration is to become a micro-businessman with a stable sales location so that he can reduce the risk that he and his wife run in going out to sell in places outside the city.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear and backpacks

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su familia, con su esposa, no tienen hijos, el negocio de Juan es la venta de ropa americana, su horario es de 8:00am a 5:00pm, de lunes a domingo.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa, camisas, faldas, short, pantalones, todo en ropa americana, para surtir el negocio, la compra le ayudara para crecer y ofrecerle a los clientes mejores productos, con esto le ayudara tambien a su familia.
El objetivo de Juan con el préstamo, es utilizar el dinero para crecer, mejorando su negocio, tambien que su familia sea favorecida con este aporte.
texts.en:
Juan is a clothes salesman.  He lives with his family, with his wife.  They do not have any children.  Juan's business is selling American clothing.  He works from 8.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Sunday.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy American clothes (shirts, skirts, shorts and pants) with which to stock his business.  This purchase will help him to grow his business and offer his customers better products.  It will also enable him to help his family.  Juan's aim for this loan is to use the money to grow and improve his business.  He also wants his family to benefit from this investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shirts, skirts, shorts and pants

loans.name: María Santos Gloria

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y un hijo. Ella es costurera desde los veinte años de edad, oficio que aprendió de su mamá.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 12 docenas de ziperes, 20 docenas de botones, 55 yardas de pelum, 15 gruesas de botones para falda y 12 cajas de hilos. Para elaborar uniformes escolares ya que es un proyecto que es una gran oportunidad para recibir ingresos económicos, además ella es bien conocida y tiene muchos clientes. El préstamo le ayudara ya que por medio de esta forma de contratos con las escuelas, ella elaborara diferentes prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her life partner and son.  She has been a dressmaker for 20 years, having learned the trade from her mom.

María is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy 12 dozen zippers, 20 dozen buttons, 55 yards of peplum, 15 large packs of skirt buttons and 12 boxes of thread.  She will use these supplies to make school uniforms as this is a great opportunity to make income.  In addition, she is well known and has a lot of customers.  The loan will help her because, through this type of contract with the schools, she will make different items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy 12 dozen zippers, 20 dozen buttons, 55 yards of peplum, 15 large packs of skirt buttons and 12 boxes of thread

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesus

texts.es:
Consuelo, vive con sus tres hijos, la casa es propia, se dedica a la venta de perfumería, desde hace 10 años tiene el negocio, es su fuente de ingreso principal para cubrir todas las necesidades.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 5 cajas de pedido de perfumería en general, como lociones y cremas de diferentes tipos, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener el negocio, comprando variedad de productos.
La aspiración de Consuelo es que a través del préstamo pueda obtener este pedido, ya que lo distribuirá a los clientes.
texts.en:
Consuelo lives with her three children in her own house. She sells perfume products, an activity she has been engaged in for 10 years. This is her main source of income, the one she pays for all her expenses with.
She is requesting a loan to buy 5 boxes of pre-ordered perfume products such as lotions and various kinds of creams. This loan will help her running her activity by buying a wide variety of products.
Consuelo wishes to be able to use this loan to purchase the items for this requested order that she will then distribute it to her customers.

loans.use: To buy lotions and various kinds of creams.

loans.name: Cesia Evelyn

texts.es:
Cesia, vive con su madre, la casa es familia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, ella tiene 5 años dedicándose al negocio, lo aprendió de su madre. En la actualidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como maíz, cal, leña, condimentos, pollo, para la elaboración de los tamales, esta compra le ayudara a mantener su nivel de ventas y garantizarlas para su ganancia.
El objetivo de Cesia es crecer en el negocio, conocer más clientes para que aumente la demanda.
texts.en:
Cesia lives with her mother in her family home. She prepares and sells tamales, an activity she has learned form her mother and in which she has been engaged for 5 years. She is currently requesting a loan to buy ingredients and supplies such as maize, lime, firewood, seasonings, and chicken to prepare her tamales. This purchase will help her keeping up with her selling rate, thus granting her the usual income.
Cesia’ goals are to see her activity grow and to gain more customers so that her requests will increase.

loans.use: To buy maize, lime, firewood, seasonings, and chicken.

loans.name: Cristina Magaly

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Cristina, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de  16, 12 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian los mayores en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido se dedica al comercio.

Ella  es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de pollos, para lo cual tres días a la semana pone un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende pollos enteros o por libras, pelados listos para el consumo. Tiene muchos clientes que le compran estos animalitos ya que los entrega bien limpios. Lleva realizando esta actividad por más de seis años y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar más pollos para la venta diaria. Este es su tercer ciclo y le gusta por la facilidad que ha tenido para conseguir el crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Querer Es Poder' community bank meet in Santa Martha, in Riochico parish, in Portoviejo.  This place is known for its vegetation and most of the local people work in agriculture.

This is where Cristina lives.  Cristina is 38 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has three children who are 16, 12 and 6 years old.  They are all in school.  The eldest children are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband works in commerce.

Cristina is a great homemaker who also works as a saleswoman.  She has a business buying and selling chickens.  Three days a week, she sets up a small sales location in her home where she sells chickens whole or by the pound.  They are plucked and ready for consumption.  She has a lot of customers who buy these animals as the ones she provides are really clean.  She has been in this business for more than six years and it is doing very well.

Cristina will use this loan to buy more chickens to sell.  This is her third loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because of the ease with which she obtains her loans.  Her dream is to own a store.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou est une veuve de 31 ans qui vit dans l’une des communautés villageoises du Sénégal.  Elle est coiffeuse et vend en meme temps de tissus teintés. Elle a une  expérience  d’un an dans cette  activité qu’elle a choisi par opportunité. Son  objectif est la recherche de bénéfices. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour la confection de boubous sénégalais qu’elle  compte envoyer  en Europe auprès de sa sœur pour la revente. Son objectif est de maximiser ses bénéfices pour mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Seynabou is a 31-year-old widow who lives in a village community in Senegal. She is a hairdresser and also sells dyed fabrics. She has been doing this work for about a year and got into it by chance. Her aim is the pursuit of profitability.

Seynabou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since September 2011. She is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs which she plans to spend on making Senegalese boubous (flowing wide sleeved robes), which she will then send to her sister in Europe for resale. Her goal is to maximise her profits so that she can achieve more self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to make clothes for export and resale.

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Madame Penda  est une femme mariée de 24 ans qui vit sur le territoire  sénégalais. Elle est mère d’un  enfant et évolue dans le monde de la coiffure et de la couture depuis 12 ans. Elle a été formée en aidant sa sœur  à gérer un salon de coiffure. Ce qui l’intéresse  dans son activité c’est la connaissance des clients et aussi la satisfaction qui leur sont procurée. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2010. Elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus qu’elle va confectionner et revendre. Son objectif est de maximiser ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Penda is a married woman who is 24 years old and lives in Senegal. She is mother to one child and has been progressing in the hairdressing and sewing field for 12 years. She was trained by helping her sister to manage a hairdressing salon. What interests her in her activity is getting to know the customers and giving them satisfaction. She has been a shareholder/member in one of UIMCEC's branches since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy fabrics which she will make up and resell. Her aim is to maximise her profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making up and reselling

loans.name: Harouna

texts.fr:
Monsieur Harouna est un jeune tailleur qui a récemment ouvert son propre atelier depuis 2006, bien qu’ayant démarré son activité depuis le jeune âge. Sa journée débute à 09h du matin, pour se terminer  22 h du soir. Il est marié et gère sa petite famille.
Le prêt qu’il consent va lui servir à acheter de la matière première c’est à dire des tissus pour les confectionner et les revendre par la suite dans le marché.
Dans l’avenir, il souhaite devenir un grand maitre tailleur.
texts.en:
Harouna is a young tailor who started in his line of work at a young age and opened his own studio in 2006. His workdays start at 9 o'clock in the morning and end at 10 o'clock at night. He is married and the head of a small household.

The loan being requested by Harouna will enable him to buy raw materials (i.e. fabric) so that he can make clothes and later resell them at the market. In the future, he would like to become a great master tailor.

loans.use: to buy fabric which to make into clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen, tiene 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos con edades de 9, 21, 23 y 27 años, vive en la aldea Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña María tiene 8 años de haber establecido con sus propios esfuerzos una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, maíz, pan, manteca, café, productos de limpieza e higiene, churros, refrescos, etc. anteriormente elaboraba sombreros de junco y los vendía, pero miro que donde ella vive quedan muy lejos las otras pulperías para comprar y decidió poner una mas cerca, pues tiene sus clientes fijos.  Abre el negocio todo el día y todos los días.ella recibe otros ingresos por parte del alquiler de una casa. 
Este negocio a superado debido a los prestamos y reinversion de ganancias, que le han permitido mantenerlo surtido, también ha podido darle el estudio a su hija. 
Doña Maria, pertenece al grupo solidario llamado los Angeles de Ceguaca, son dos socias y han solicitado L.10,000.00 cada una.
Actualmente con ODEF lleva dos préstamos solicitados y este actual le ayudara a surtir de productos que no tiene en existencia, va comprar frijoles, maíz, arroz, manteca, café, churros y refrescos.
Tiene como meta mantener surtido para brindarles un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, age 43, is married and has for children, ages 9, 21, 23, and 27.  She lives in the village of Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara.  Her husband is a farmer.

Eight years ago María, through her own efforts, established a grocery store.  She sells staples like rice, beans, corn, bread, lard, coffee, cleaning and hygiene products, churros, and soft drinks, etc.  She used to make hats from rushes and then sell them.  However, she saw that she lives very far from other grocery stores, and she decided to establish one closer.  The store is open all day every day.  She receives other income from renting a house.

This business has done well due to the loans and the reinvestment of her earnings, which have allowed her to keep it stocked.  She has also been able to give her daughter an education.

Maria belongs to the Angeles de Ceguaca communal bank, which has two members.  They have requested 10,000 lempiras each.  At present she has two loans she has requested with ODEF.  This current one will help her to stock products that she does not have.  She will buy beans, corn, rice, lard, coffee, churros, and soft drinks.  Her goal is to keep her business stocked in order to provide her customers with good service.

loans.use: to stock her store with grocery products like basic grains, bread, lard, coffee, and cleaning and hygiene products, etc.

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr: Madame Mame  Penda est âgée  de 43 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le secteur de la  restauration (vend déjeuner et diner). Elle a  commencé  ses activités en servant du goûter  a ses clients. C’est par la suite que ces derniers ont manifesté le besoin d’acheter le déjeuner et le diner chez elle. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité ce sont les flux financiers et la satisfaction de ses clients. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un stock de denrées qu’elle utilise pour la préparation des repas qu’elle commercialise afin de contourner l’inflation et maximiser  ses bénéfices. Les bénéfices réalisés avec   ses crédits précédents lui ont permis d’acheter son propre congélateur.
texts.en: Mrs Mame Penda is 43 years old. She lives in Senegal and works in catering (she sells lunch and dinner).She started her business serving snacks to her clients. Subsequently her customers demonstrated the need to buy lunch and dinner from her too. What interest her most in her commerce are the financial flow and her customers’ satisfaction. She has been a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC since November 2003. She requests a loan of 150 000 Frs. for the purchase of a stock of products that she uses for the preparation of the meals that she sells in order to sidestep inflation and maximise her profits. The profits made with her previous loans have enabled her to purchase her own freezer.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for the preparation of the meals that she sells.

loans.name: El Hadji . Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadji. Lamine est un jeune marié de 33 ans qui habite au Sénégal. C’est un professeur d’arabe qui évolue en meme temps dans le commerce et la vente de chaussures, sacs, mil, riz, arachide  et foulards. Il a une expérience de deux ans dans le commerce. Elle a choisi cette activité pour arrondir ses fins de mois. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat des produits qu’il commercialise et qui sont destinés à la vente. Il souhaite mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
El Hadji. Lamine is a young married man of 33 years of age who lives in Senegal. He is a teacher of Arabic and a salesman, and sells shoes, bags, millet, rice, groundnuts and scarves. He has been a salesman for 2 years and chose the extra work in order to supplement his income.

El Hadji. Lamine has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since October 2011. He is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that he can restock on products for resale. He wishes to make his sales business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy shoes, scarves, bags and local products for resale.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 42 года.  Основным источником дохода для семьи Замиры, состоящей из ее дочки и матери,  является животноводство, начатое в 2002 году. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), использованной на покупку одной дойной коровы, Замира смогла развить свое хозяйство, приносящее около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков для откорма и перепродажи и десяти овец. Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Zamira is 42 years old. The main source of income for Zamira’s household, which includes her daughter and mother, is animal farming. She launched her business in 2002. Starting with an initial capital of 10,000 KGS used for purchasing a single dairy cow,  Zamira has been able to  expand her farm, which now brings in about 7,000 monthly from selling meat and dairy products. In order to develop her business further, Zamira turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan of 100,000 to purchase two calves for fattening and resale, along with ten sheep. Zamira plans to invest her income into expanding her livestock further. In the future, she dreams of building a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Congo town. She is married with three children aged between eight and twenty-five. They live at home. One has finished high-school while the two younger ones attend school.

For the past thirty years, Helen has been selling charcoal. She started this business from her savings. One of the challenges she faces is the cost of transportation. She enjoys her business because it helps her to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Jesús

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 12 y 10 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y  la menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Ella se dedica a la cría de aves de corral y chanchos,  tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría estos animalitos que  los compra pequeños, los cría durante tres meses que es el tiempo que se demoran en estar listos para la venta, luego los entrega a comerciantes y personas de lugar que le compra para el consumo. Ella  también tiene cultivos de ciclo invernal y en la actualidad está por sembrar maíz y maní, razón por la cual ha solicitado el crédito pues lo quiere utilizar para comprar semillas, insumos y fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha, también va a comprar alimento para los pollos.

Es su tercer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta porque los créditos que ha recibido le han ayudado mucho tanto en su negocio como en su vida personal.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Santa Martha, in the Riochico parish located in Portoviejo, the members of the “Querer Es Poder De Riochico” communal bank meet every two weeks. This place is known for its vegetation where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture.

In this place, we meet Carmen. She is 34 years old. She is married and she has four children who are 15, 13, 12 and 10 years old. The oldest three are in high school. The youngest one is in school. Her husband is a driver.

She raises poultry and pigs. She has a small farm where she raises the little animals that she buys when they are young. She raises them for three months which is the time needed to be ready for sale. Later, she delivers them to merchants and people in the area who purchase them for consumption.
