She also plants crops for the winter cycle and currently, she is about to plant corn and peanuts. For this reason, she had requested a loan to use for purchasing seeds, consumables and fertilizers in order to have a good harvest. She will also purchase food for the chickens.

This is her third cycle in the communal bank. She is very happy because the loans that she has received have helped her so much with her business and with her personal life.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: purchase seeds, consumables, fertilizers and food for chickens.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Madame Daba habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce de produits divers. Elle vend des produits  locaux (mil, arachide, haricot local ). En meme temps elle pratique l’aviculture. Elle a une expérience de 15 ans dans ses activités qu’elle a  choisies par opportunité.  Elle profite bien de l’abondance des produits locaux dans les villages et de leur raréfaction en ville. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de  cette zone depuis décembre 2010. Elle a déjà remboursé 1 prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’arachide au village qu’elle va faire décortiquer et  revendre. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux supporter ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mrs Daba lives in Senegal. She is 37 years old. She is married and works in the commerce of various products. She sells local products (millet, groundnut, local beans).At the same time she practises poultry farming. She has 15 years experience in her activities that she chose by opportunity. She takes advantage of the abundance of local products in the villages and their rarity in town. She has been a member of the local branch of the U-IMCEC since December 2010.She has already repaid one previous loan. She requests a credit of 100 000 Frs. for the purchase of groundnuts in her village that she will have shelled and resell. The increase in her profits will enable to support her personal needs with more ease.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts to shell and resell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 57 years old, from Nakuru, and is married with six children.

Rachael sells vegetables at her stall she has been operating for the past three years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more vegetables to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business and venture into herbal products.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a 31-year-old livestock keeper in Voi. He is a married father of one. He has been rearing livestock and selling livestock products for the past year. He is doing great. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more goats, cattle and poultry. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to construct a residential house for his family. He hopes to have a healthy, happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle to rear

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 25 years old, from Ndunyu Njeru, and is married with one child who is six months old.

David has a cattle-rearing business which he has been doing for the past year. He is applying for his loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a heifer for rearing. He hopes to expand his business and also venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her used clothes business.

loans.name: Tening

texts.fr: Madame Tening  est une femme mariée de 25 ans. Elle est mère d’un enfant et vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans la vente de friperie, de chips et de jus locaux. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité de commerce. Elle est membre  du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa localité d’habitation depuis octobre  2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de friperie en gros en vue de stimuler ses ventes et bénéfices. Son objectif est de subvenir  à ses petits besoins personnels avec les revenus qu’elle gagne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tening, age 25, lives in Senegal. She's married and the mother of one child. She sells secondhand clothes, chips, and local juices. She has five years of experience in her business.

She's been a member of the local UIMCEC branch in her place of residence since October, 2010. She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, intended to buy secondhand clothing wholesale, in order to increase her sales and profits.

Her goal is to be able to provide for her own needs with the income she earns.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to resell

loans.name: Asiman

texts.ru:
Asiman 39 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoritye jivut vmeste snim i yego jenoy v Absheron regione. Asiman yavlyayetsya IDP person pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona .Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов.
Asiman uje 5 let kak rabotayet uchitelem. On ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i svoix uchenikov i poetomu chtobi uludshit i pomoch detam v uchebe on nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu dosku dlya raspisi i knigi dlya detey.
texts.en:
Asiman is 39 years old.  He is married and has two children, who live together with him and his wife in the Absheron region.  Asiman is an IDP from the Kalbadjar region.  He has been working as a teacher for five years.  He loves his work and his students very much.  This is why he needs 1000 AZN to purchase new writing boards and books for children in order to improve and help the children.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person, who was forced to suddenly flee his home as a result of a military conflict, violence, violation of human rights, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but what differentiates him from a refugee is the fact that did not cross an international border and is located on the territory of his own country (source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy new writing boards and books

loans.name: Kochari

texts.ru: Kochari yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Djabrail seychas jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi.Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов). On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Kochari 45 let. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyego traktora tak kak on ne mojet polzovatsya im poka on isporchen.
texts.en:
Kochari is an IDP from Djabrail and now lives in the Absheron region together with his wife and children.  He is married and has three children.  Kochari is 45 years old.  He has been involved in agriculture for seven years.  Currently, he needs 1000 AZN to buy spare parts for his tractor because he cannot use it while it is broken.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person, who was forced to suddenly flee his home as a result of a military conflict, violence, violation of human rights, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but what differentiates him from a refugee is the fact that did not cross an international border and is located on the territory of his own country (source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tractor

loans.name: Bandali

texts.ru:
Bandali 27 let. On jenat no ne imeyet detey. Uje 3 qoda kak on imeyet market dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji. Bandali trudolubiviy chelovek on lubit delat novshestva v svoyey rabote i prodvigat svoy bizness vperod.
Bandali yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Lachin seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов).
texts.en:
Bandali is 27 years old.  He is married, but does not have children.  He has had a food market for three years.  Currently, Bandali needs 1000 AZN to purchase products for resale.  Bandali is a hardworking person, and loves to create innovations in his work and advance his business.  Bandali is an IDP from Lachin and now lives in the Absheron region together with his wife.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person, who was forced to suddenly flee his home as a result of a military conflict, violence, violation of human rights, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but what differentiates him from a refugee is the fact that did not cross an international border and is located on the territory of his own country (source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy products for resale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 46-year-old business lady. She is married to Ngonyi, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. Monica has been running a retail shop for the past 4 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her sixth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Monica will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Alma Etelvina

texts.es:
Alma Etelvina, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 15 años, su esposo se dedica hacer trabajos de soldadura, tiene 4 hijos de edades entre 8 a 15 años, vive con su familia en la aldea San Isidro del Rosario, Comayagua.

Alma tiene gran habilidad para hacer pan casero, aprendió desde pequeña con su familia.  Emprendió su propio negocio con esfuerzos propios,  ella lleva 10 años de realizar esta actividad donde elabora diferentes tipos de pan como ser Rosquillas de maíz, Alporas de maíz y quesadilla de queso. 
Trabaja 10 horas diarias los días jueves y los domingos siendo sus días fuertes de venta. Este pan es vendido en la comunidad y en el mercado local y por pedidos.
Ha hecho crecer el negocio con ayuda de los préstamos, los que le han permitido obtener los ingresos necesarios para el hogar. Actualmente esta solicitando el quinto préstamo, el cual lo invertirá en materia prima como harina, harina de maíz, manteca, queso, leche, huevos, azúcar y otros, para seguir manteniendo la demanda de clientes.
Su meta es ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Alma Etelvina, age 32, has been married for 15 years.  Her husband does soldering work.  She has four children between the ages of 8 and 15.  She lives with her family in the San Isidro del Rosario Village, Comayagua.

Alma has a great ability for making homemade bread.  She learned with her family when she was little.  She undertook her own business through her own efforts.  She has been doing this business activity for ten years.  She makes different types of bread like “Rosquillas de maíz” ,“Alporas de maíz” (corn pastries), and cheese quesadillas.

She works ten hours a day.  Thursdays and Sundays are the days there are the strongest sales.  This bread is sold in the community, in the local market, and by orders.

She has made her business grow with help from the loans.  The loans have allowed her to get the needed income for her household.

She is currently requesting her fifth loan.  She will use it to buy raw material like flour, corn flour, lard, cheese, milk, eggs, sugar, and others in order to continue meeting her customers’ demand.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw material like flour, corn flour, lard, cheese, milk, eggs, sugar, and others.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru:
Дамире 53 года, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей. Дамира работает бухгалтером в Сельской Ассоциации водопользователей и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, ведет бизнес в животноводстве. Стартовав в 2004 году с начальной суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), Дамира смогла развить свое хозяйство, приносящее около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Дамиры имеется три дойные коровы, три лошади, и пятьдесят овец. Доходы от бизнес- деятельности позволили Дамире оплатить учебу в университете для своих детей. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Дамира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Damira is 53 years old, married and raised five children.  She works as an accountant at the Village Association of water users and, as an additional source of income for her family, runs an animal husbandry business.  Having started in 2004 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS), Damira was able to develop her business to yield 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products.  Today, her business contains three dairy cows, three horses and fifty sheep.  The earnings from this business allowed Damira to pay for her children's university education.  In order to further grow her business, Damira requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the profits into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sonaiym

texts.ru:
Сонаим 33 года, замужем, воспитывает трех детей - школьников.  Основным источником дохода для семьи Сонаим является животноводство. Стартовав с  покупки пяти овец, Сонаим смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью  в 4,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили Сонаим приобрести дом для семьи в своем селе.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сонаим обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Сонаим планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает видеть своих детей – студентами университета.
texts.en: Sonaiym is 33 years old, married and is raising three school-age children.  Her family's primary source of income is animal husbandry.  Having started with a purchase of five sheep, Sonaiym was able to develop her business to yield a monthly profit of 4,000 som (KGS).  The earnings from this business allowed Sonaiym to buy a house for her family in her village.  In order to further develop her business, Sonaiym requested a loan in the sum of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the profits into increasing livestock headcount further and, in the future, dreams to see her children as university students.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Vibula Group

texts.en:
Selemani is in his late fifties and is married with four children. He has been selling clothes for ten years now. He works from 7am to 10pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Selemani’s loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase stock and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. Selemani’s dream is to one day build his own house.

Selemani will share this loan with his loan group, "Vibula", which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add more stock to her grocery inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to open an electrical goods shop.

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo que se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

En este lugar vive la señora  Mercedes, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos de crianza ya que ella nunca pudo tener hijos propios y crio desde pequeños a los que ella considera sus hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y la menor de 6 años  que estudia en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa de transporte.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) y Leonisa (ropa interior para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta y trabaja todos los días en las tardes, la mayoría de sus productos los vende bajo pedidos que de forma anticipada le realizan sus clientes, lo que más vende son los perfumes y ropa interior. La ropa la va a  comprar cada 15 días a Guayaquil y Quito. Lleva en el negocio más de 14 años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar  y cosméticos Yanbal. Lleva más de 3 años   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The 8 De Mayo communal bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita province.  The city is surrounded by wonderful beaches and has a hot and pleasant climate, with beautiful and tenacious women.

Portoviejo is also the place where Mercedes lives.  She is 60 years old, married, and has three children whom she raised—Mercedes was never able to have children of her own and raised them since they were small, so she considers them her children.  Two of them are now adults, while the youngest is 6 years old and is in school.  Mercedes’ husband works in a transportation cooperative.

Mercedes makes a living selling Yanbal-brand products (beauty products and toiletries) and Leonisa-brand products (women’s undergarments).  Her sales method is going door to door, and she works every day in the afternoon.  She sells most of her products to her customers on advance order, and her most popular items are perfumes and undergarments.  She goes to Guayaquil and Quito every 15 days to purchase the clothing.  She has had this business for more than 14 years and it is going very well. 

Mercedes is going to use this loan to purchase Yanbal-brand cosmetics.  She has been a member of her communal bank for more than 3 years, and she likes it because the loans have increased her business each time.

Mercedes’ aim is to get ahead in her work.

loans.use: to purchase Yanbal-brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Kenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Kenia, vive con su esposo y una hija de 17 años, ella se dedica a atender una tienda de productos domésticos, el lugar donde viven es propicio para tener clientes frecuentemente, ya que están ubicados cerca de la unidad de salud.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de teléfonos celulares, para agregarlos a la venta, es por medio de este préstamo que se le permitirá mejorar el negocio, ofreciendo a los clientes una línea de celulares para su necesidad.
El objetivo de ella es seguir creciendo, mejorando cada día para garantizar más ganancias a su familia.
texts.en:
Kenia lives with her husband and a 17-year-old daughter.  She works attending to a household products store.  The place they live is favorable to having customers frequently because they are located near the health center.

She is requesting a loan to invest in buying cell phones to add for sale.  This loan will allow her to improve her business, offering her customers a line of cell phones for their needs.

Her goal is to continue growing, improving every day to guarantee more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo que se reúne cada quince días.

La señora María tiene 30 años de  edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ella tiene  tres hijos de 5,  3 y de 1 año. Su esposo trabaja en una oficina de transporte en Guayaquil.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal, Esika y Avon (productos de belleza y perfumería) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, trabaja de de lunes a viernes unas tres horas diarias y los sábados y domingos en las tardes ya que en estos días realiza los cobros de sus productos, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días  o por quincenas. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y los cosméticos, lleva más de 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 2 años y le ha gusta la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir ampliando su negocio y que  a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Portoviejo, (the capital of Manabita), a place with a warm and agreeable climate, we meet the communal bank "8 de Mayo."  This group meets every 15 days. 

Maria, 30, is married and she and her husband have three children aged 5, 3 and 1.  Her husband works in a transportation office in Guayaquil.

Maria has a business selling Yanbal, Esika and Avon products (beauty products and perfumes.)  She makes her sales door-to-door, taking orders.  She works from Monday to Friday, three hours a day, and on Saturdays and Sundays in the afternoons, because this is when she makes her collections.  She sells on credit and collects every 8 days, or bi-weekly.  What she sells the most are perfumes and cosmetics.  She has been doing this work for 7 years, and it is going quite well.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics.  She has been with her communal bank for 2 years, and she likes how quickly they are able to get the loans.

Her dreams are to continue to expand her business, and to see that her children have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: Yanet Del Carmen

texts.es: Yanet del Carmen tiene  50 años de edad, ella era maestra de primaria se retiro para seguir  uno de sus sueños que era crear un centro escolar  infantil en la comunidad y lo cumplió actualmente es la administradora y propietaria es una emprendedora exitosa y es un ejemplo para sus hijos, ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que todavía están estudiando y los otros mayores la apoyan económicamente de igual manera su esposo. Yanet está solicitando financiamiento para realizarles algunas remodelaciones a su vivienda, lo cual comprara materiales de construcción como hierro, cemento, perlines entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Yanet del Carmen is 50 years old. She was an elementary school teacher and retired in order to pursue one of her dreams which was to open a children's preschool center in the community, a dream she fulfilled. Currently she is the manager/owner, a successful entrepreneur and an example for her children. She has two children under her care who are still in school, and the older ones support her financially as well as her husband. 

Yanet is seeking a loan in order to do some remodeling of her living quarters. She will purchase construction materials such as ironwork, cement and roofing beams among others.

loans.use: to purchase ironwork, cement and roofing beams among other materials.

loans.name: Sorie Okereh's Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Mabonkani village, near Makeni. Sorie is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 59-year-old Sorie was born in Gbanti village in northern Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He is married to a trader, and the couple has seven children together. Two of his children are attending primary and secondary schools, three are in college, and the rest are no longer attending school. Sorie has requested this loan in order to buy house-building material like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, bags of cement, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Doña Karla, sigue con su trabajo de colaboladora hospitalaria, en donde hace posible seguir adelante con su objetivo, es madre soltera de un hijo el, cual cursa el quinto año, las mejoras han sido su pioridad, pero no habia logrado comenzar por falta de capital.
 Con el financiamiento le es mas viable al ser a plazos. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, terminara la construccion del baño, en donde comprara materiales de construccion en bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, y puerta. Lo que tendra mejor seguridad y privacidad de higiene.
texts.en:
Karla continues with her job as a hospital assistant, which makes it possible to continue getting ahead with her goal.  She is the single mother of one child who is in fifth grade.  Improvements have been her priority, but she had not managed to begin due to lack of capital.

With the loan it is more viable for her to do it in installments.  Now, with this new loan, she will finish building the bathroom.  She will buy construction materials--stones, sand, cement, metal, and a door--and will have better security and privacy for hygiene.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom, to have better privacy and hygiene.

loans.name: Meylikan

texts.ru:
Мейликан 58 лет. Мейликан долгое время работала медсестрой, сейчас на пенсии. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Мейликан занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое еще в период Советского Союза со 100 советских рублей хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в день от продажи молока. На данный момент в хозяйстве Мейликан  две дойные коровы, одна лошадь и десять овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мейликан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной телки. Доходы Мейликан планирует вложить в посев фасоли на 3,5 га земли, и в дальнейшем - увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Meylikan is 58 years old. She has been working as a nurse for a long time and now is retired. Meylikan is engaged in animal husbandry and crop-farming which are a source of income for her family. The animal husbandry business was set up back in the Soviet times with 100 Soviet roubles, and currently brings in about 7,000 som (KGS) per day from the sale of milk. As of today, Meylikan's farm counts two dairy cows, one horse and ten sheep.
In order to further develop her business, Meylikan sought help from Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase one heifer. Meylikan is planning on investing her earnings from the loan in planting 3.5 ha of beans, and in the future she wants to increase the livestock population.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Umarr B.

texts.en:
Pictured above is Umarr, a teacher in one of the secondary schools in Makeni. He has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan. Like other teachers, he wants this loan in order to meet some financial commitments that his salary alone cannot solve. But with the help of this loan, he can meet these challenges and at the end of each month, he will use his monthly salary to offset the loan.  

Umarr was born in Masapirie village, in northern Sierra Leone. The 30-year-old is married to a teacher and has served in the teaching profession for four years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Amalfi

texts.es: Amalfi de 42 años de edad tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 15 años; ella es la propietaria de un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de llamadas a celulares y también ofrece servicios de juegos y videos. Su idea de negocio nació muy espontáneamente, a su esposo le gustaba jugar play, compró su equipo de juegos y todas las tardes lo niños se reunían en su casa a jugar, ellos hacían fila y así fue como Amalfi empezó a alquilarlo, gradualmente se agregaron mas vecinos y por eso logró unos ahorros e invirtió; hoy tienen 2 play y 3 televisores. En la actualidad su clientela de niños y jóvenes se incrementa permanentemente,  no sabe de donde sale tantos clientes especialmente estudiantes, últimamente hasta le preguntan por  el servicio de fotocopiaje del que aun carece. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 2 juegos de play 2 televisores y una fotocopiadora. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y organizar un café internet muy confortable. Mientras esto ocurre  maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 62%, desde la cual parte para empezar su ascenso.
texts.en:
Amalfi, age 42, has a family that consists of her husband and two children (ages 22 and 15). She is the owner of a business that offers mobile phone calling services. In addition, she offers video game and movie video services. The idea for this business came to her quite spontaneously. Her husband enjoys playing video games, so she bought the gaming equipment and every afternoon the children gathered at her house to play. They began forming a line, so she started renting out the games. Over time, more of her neighbors began visiting, so she was able to save some money to invest. Today she has two video game consoles and three televisions. At the moment, her customer base is constantly increasing and consists mainly of children and young people, especially students. Recently, customers have asked about photocopying, a service that she does not offer.

For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy two video games, two televisions, and a photocopier. Her dream is to expand her business and organize it into an Internet café that is quite comfortable. In the meantime, Amalfi is able to maintain sales profitability of 62%, a sign that points to the start of her growth.

loans.use: to buy two video games, two televisions, and a photocopier.

loans.name: Blanca Sofia

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo que se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 7 años el  mismo que estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja con su familia en un restaurante y hostería.

Ella  al igual que su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el negocio de la familia ya que es de esto que todos pueden tener su sustento diario, ellos tienen un restaurante y hostería muy conocido en la ciudad, allí ella al igual que todos los miembros de la familia trabajan todos los días tanto en el restaurante como en la hostería, la familia de su esposo tiene este negocio por más de 30 años y su esposo desde muy joven también empezó en el mismo.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal por cuatro años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para mejorar su vida diaria.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
The 8 De Mayo communal bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita province.  The city is surrounded by wonderful beaches and has a hot and pleasant climate, with beautiful and tenacious women.

Portoviejo is also the place where Blanca lives.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one child who is 7 years old and in school.  Blanca’s husband works at his family’s restaurant and lodging house.

Blanca and her husband both make a living working in the family business, which is how they are able to meet their daily expenses.  The family’s restaurant and lodging house is well known in the city.  Blanca and the other members of the family work every day in the restaurant as well as in the lodging house.  Her husband’s family has had this business for more than 30 years, and her husband started working there when he was very young.

Blanca is going to use this loan to purchase supplies that are needed for food preparation.  She has been a member of the communal bank for four years, and she likes it because the loans have helped to improve her daily life.

Blanca's dream is to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Satinsa

texts.ru:
Сатинсе 60 лет, замужем.  Основным источником дохода для семьи Сатинсы  является животноводство, начатое еще 20 лет назад. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), Сатинса смогла развить свое хозяйство, приносящее около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сатинсы имеется четыре дойной коровы и двадцать пять овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сатинса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Сатинса планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Satinsa is a 60-year-old married woman. The animal husbandry business was set up 20 years ago and today is the main source of income for Satinsa's family. Satinsa managed to expand the farm, which was started with the sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Today it brings in around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products. As of today, Satinsa's farm counts four dairy cows and twenty-five sheep.
In order to further develop her business, Satinsa has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of livestock. Satinsa is planning on investing the earnings from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nelly Yolanda

texts.es:
Nelly Yolanda  tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14,2 y un año de edad, el mayor estudia, ella vive con su familia en la aldea Subirana de Morazan, Yoro.
Nelly se dedicaba a vender cosméticos y ropa, los ingresos que esta actividad le generaba no eran suficientes para la aportación a su familia, pero hace 2 años con la ayuda de su esposo decidieron dedicarse a la actividad de cultivo de café, el cual a la vez lo venden satisfactoriamente. Le dedica  2 horas diarias.
Ella esta solicitando 5,000 lempiras para comprar abono e insumos para sus cultivos  y así poderle brindar una mejor asistencia y sacar buenas cosechas.   
Con los ingresos obtenidos podrán construir su propia casa y así ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Nelly Yolanda is 34 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 2, and 1). Her oldest child is in school. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Subirana in Morazan, Yoro.

Nelly sells cosmetics and clothing. The income she generates from this business is not enough to support her family. Two years ago and with the help of her husband, she decided to grow coffee and this product has sold very well. She dedicates two hours a day to this activity.

Nelly is requesting 5000 HNL so that she can buy compost and farming supplies for her crops. This will enable her to provide the best care so that she can achieve a good harvest. With the income she will earn, Nelly will be able to build a house of her own and provide her children with a better quality of life and a good education.

loans.use: to buy compost and farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Yubica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CUSI COYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yubica; ella tiene 19 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de artesanía ella confecciona chompas,fajas,chuyos entre otros ella se dedica a la textileria ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio el cual el esta yendo bien , a la vez la socia es estudiante de la carrera profesional de administración ella está recién iniciando su carrera la cual espera poder terminar y continuar con su negocio y de esta manera crecer como profesional junto a su negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como lana de alpaca y oveja.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Cusi Coyllor de Chinchero" communal bank, located in Chinchero district, which is part of Urubamba province in Cusco department. The borrower is Yubica, and she is 19 years old. She alternates her daily activities with her business making handicrafts. She makes sweaters, sashes, wool hats, and other items.

She has been making textile products and running her business for several years, and it's going well. At the same time, she is a student, studying for a degree in administration. She recently started her degree program and she hopes to be able to finish it and continue with her business, and in this way grow as a professional and in her business. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy materials such as alpaca and sheep's wool. The borrower promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy materials such as alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Helmer

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CUSI COYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Helmer; el tiene 24 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi en la ruta Cusco –Chinchero, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este el saca adelante a su familia, el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su carro como el cambio de aceite.

El socio se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The associate is a member of the communal bank 'CUSI COYLLOR DE CHINCHERO'. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. 

The associate is  Helmer, he is 24 years old, lives with his partner and has one child. He has a taxi service which he runs daily in the route from Cusco to Chinchero. He has been working in this business for years and it is through this that he is able to help his family get ahead. He is a very happy and responsible person with a strong desire to get ahead. 

The associate has requested this loan to do maintenance on his car, like changing the oil.  
 
He promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his car, like changing the oil.

loans.name: Amada Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amada es  casada y se dedica a la actividad de pulpería donde vende diversos productosentre los que se encuentran de aseo personal como cremas corporales, shampoo, perfumes. Empieza su actividad comercial desde las 5 de la mañana ofreciendo sus productos de primera necesidad a su clientela, cerrando su negocio a las 10 de la noche.

La señora Amadaestá solicitando el crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares así como útiles escolares que utilizaran los estudiantes para la próxima entrada a clases. Con dichos uniformes, cuadernos y lápices logrará satisfacer la demanda de los clientes para dar inicio muy satisfactoriamente al ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Amada is married and makes a living from the small store she owns. She sells a diverse collection of products, including personal hygiene products like body lotions, shampoo and perfume. She opens her store at 5 a.m., offering products of basic needs to her customers, and closes the business at 10 p.m.

Amada is requesting a loan to buy school uniforms and school supplies that the students will use for the coming entry to school. With these uniforms, notebooks and pencils she will be able to meet the demand of her customers so they can start the school year successfully.

loans.use: to buy products like notebooks, pens, colored pencils, school uniforms, socks, slips, and backpacks.

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra de Jesús, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y gaseosas, ella realiza sus compras a las 5:00 am y posteriormente se dedica a vender en su puesto fijo y sus hijas se movilizan ambulantes en diferentes unidades de buses interurbanos ofreciendo las frutas y las verduras. 

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de bananos, chiltomas, tomate, mandarinas, cebollas, gaseosas y jugos vareados al por mayor y así lograr obtener mejores ganancias al igual que mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Isidra de Jesús makes her living selling fruits, vegetables and sodas.  She makes her purchases at 5:00 am and later sells the produce from a fixed stall while her daughters go around to different intercity bus units selling the fruits and vegetables.

The loan will be used to purchase wholesale bananas, sweet peppers, tomatoes, tangerines, onions, sodas and a variety of juices so that she will earn a better profit as well as improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, sweet peppers, tomatoes, tangerines, onions, sodas, a variety of juices etc.

loans.name: Mirando El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Mirando al Futuro” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de comida rápida, helados, chocolatería, pasteles y venta de libros, ropa usada, artesanía, atención de almacén y bazar, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Claudia integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, su cabello es color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado, para una mejor referencia se encuentra al lado izquierdo de la emprendedora más alta que se ve al fondo del grupo.
Claudia se dedica al rubro de los servicios, específicamente a la pedicura y manicure. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 4 meses, posterior a un curso que realizó. Su horario de trabajo es flexible, ya que atiende en su propia casa y en los domicilios particulares de sus clientes.
Comenta que después de participar en una feria navideña, captó una gran cantidad de clientes, situación que le ha servido para aumentar sus ingresos.
Además promociona su servicio colocando un letrero afuera de su casa.
Su mercadería la compra en un local en el centro de la ciudad.
Con el crédito comprará esmalte de uñas con diseño, quita esmalte, algodón y acrílicos. Con estos materiales abastecerá su negocio durante tres meses.
Sus metas son invertir una mayor cantidad de dinero en materiales.
Claudia vive junto a su madre y sus tres hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son realizar cursos de perfeccionamiento en podología.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio.
Comenta que se siente muy cómoda con la compañía del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que realizan actividades en conjunto, por lo que están muy afiatados.
Respecto a las capacitaciones estas le han servido para organizar de mejor manera la contabilidad de su negocio.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Mirando al Futuro” (Looking to the Future) and consists of 19 entrepreneurs who engage in different businesses such as preparing fast food, ice cream, chocolates, pastries, selling books, used clothing, handicrafts, managing a store and bazaar, and other ventures. All of them live in the community of Independencia, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Claudia is a member of this Communal Bank. In the photograph, she is standing in the back row and has dark brown hair. As a better reference, she is the woman who is standing much higher than the rest of the group. Claudia is in the service industry, specifically providing pedicures and manicures. She started in this business four months ago after completing a course. Her work schedule is flexible. She works from her own home and at the homes of her customers. Claudia says that after she participated at a Christmas fair, she was able to attract a large number of customers. This event helped to increase her income. She also promotes her service by placing a sign outside of her house. Claudia buys her supplies at a shop in the central part of the city.

With this loan, Claudia will buy designer nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton, and acrylics. These supplies should last for the next three months in her business. Her goals include investing more money in these materials. Claudia lives with her mother and her three children (ages 7, 4, and 2). Her dreams on a personal level include finishing courses so that she will be more knowledgeable about foot care. She is very pleased with and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza. This has enabled her to invest in her business. She says that she is very comfortable with her Communal Bank group. They have already worked together in several activities and have become very close. With respect to the training classes, Claudia is able to better organize the accounting of her business.

Independencia is one of 34 communities that make up the city of Santiago, the capital of Chile. It is located in the north-central sector. At the end of the nineteenth century, Independencia emerged as the most traditional section of the city. The main thoroughfare is Independencia Avenue, which served as the old Incan Road and the passageway to the north from the city of Santiago. Given the growing indigenous population, Independencia is known as the “Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile”. There are also historical buildings, including six Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: to buy a three-month supply of designer nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton, and acrylics.

loans.name: Flor Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 40 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 7 años, todos aun viven con ella y estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que para sacar a sus hijos adelante en este mundo tan difícil se dedica a la venta de detergentes, desinfectantes, cloro, entre otras cosas, ella contrata personal que es el que va ofreciendo puerta a puerta los productos y a quienes les paga un sueldo, también vende en su casa sobre todo a vecinos y comerciantes que ya que les vende a mejor precio y al por mayor. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta un poco más tarde cuando tiene que recibir o entregar los pedidos. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más productos como cloro, detergentes, desinfectantes, entre otras cosas. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio ya que es fundadora del banco y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy ordenadas y cumplidas con sus obligaciones.
 
Su sueño es tener una distribuidora a nivel provincial.
texts.en:
The members of the “Nueva Estrella Solidaria” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Municipal neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Flor, 40, here.  She’s a single mother of four children who are 20, 18, 13 and 7 years old; they all still live with her and attend University, secondary school and elementary school.

She is a great housewife who in order to raise her children in this very difficult world sells detergent, disinfectant and bleach, among other things.  She hires personnel to help her sell the products door to door and pays them a salary.  She also sells from home especially to neighbors and merchants that she sells to at a better price and at wholesale.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm and sometimes even a little later when she has to receive or deliver orders.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and does very well.

She will use this loan to buy more products like bleach, detergent and disinfectant, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning since she’s a founding member of the bank; she likes it because her fellow members are very organized and they meet their obligations.  Her dream is to have a provincial level distributorship.

loans.use: to buy bleach, detergent, disinfectants, etc.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia es cliente antigua de la institución desde el 2002 antes trabajaba con el grupo solidario CHIRIHUAYAITA y MOSQUETERAS pero el grupo se  separo y ella perdió el nexo con la institución  y con sus compañeras de grupo, volvió a trabajar con la institución pero ya de manera individual, ella vive en la calle zona de  Mallasa  se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos como refrescos, dulces, papa fritas, en su kiosco en un parque muy concurrido de la ciudad de La Paz el préstamo que están solicitando es para la compra de 5 puertas para el departamento donde vivirá  ya que le falta terminar la construcción, solo en el colocado de puertas, ella es un apersona muy responsable, con esta actividad mantiene a su familia y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia is a long-time client of Emprender since 2002. She previously worked with the solidarity group “Chirihuayaita y Mosqueteras”, but the group disbanded. Claudia lost touch with Emprender and the other members of her group. However, she returned to work with Emprender on an individual basis.

She lives along a street in the Mallasa District and sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, candy, and potato chips from a kiosk at a busy park in the city of La Paz. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy five doors for the apartment where she will live, which is in the final stages of construction. The only things that need to be installed are the doors.

Claudia is a very responsible person. Through her business, she is able to support her family. She is very grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase five doors for her apartment.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco comunal “Un Desafío para Todos” perteneciente a la comuna Puente Alto, ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Se dedica a vender productos de belleza en la feria, específicamente cremas, colonias, jabones, cremas de afeitar, entre otros artículos. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 30 años. Sus productos los compra por despacho y distribuidoras. Su horario de atención en la feria es de las 8ºº hasta las 15ºº horas de la tarde, de martes a domingo. Los días lunes se dedica a vender sus productos puerta a puerta.
Comenta que tuvo un local establecido en el patio de su casa, sin embargo debió cerrarlo durante 2 años por problemas personales. Por lo que ahora sus metas son abrirlo nuevamente, ya que cuenta con maquinarias, entre teléfono público, cortadora de fiambres vitrinas, pesas, entre otros. 
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción, para arreglar la infraestructura de su local, ya que durante el invierno se llueve el techo. 
Patricia vive junto a su hija de 22 años, quien trabaja de manera dependiente como contador auditor.
Uno de sus sueños es ampliar la infraestructura de su casa para remodelar sus espacios.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para organizar mejor su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, éste es muy comprometido y responsable. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Patricia is part of the “Un Desafío para Todos” (A Challenge for Everyone) communal bank belonging to Puente Alto Commune in the city of Santiago.  She sells beauty products in street markets, specifically creams, colognes, soaps and shaving cream, among other products.  She’s been in this line of work for 30 years.  She buys her products from distributors and offices.  She tends to customers in the street markets from 8am until 3pm, Tuesday to Sunday; Mondays she sells door to door.

She comments that she once had a locale in her yard but had to close it for two years due to personal problems.  Her goal now is to reopen it because she has the machinery, public phone, meat slicer and scales, among others.  She will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to repair her locale’s infrastructure because during the winter the roof leaks.

Patricia lives with her 22-year-old daughter who is employed as an auditing accountant.   One of her dreams is to expand the infrastructure of her house to remodel its rooms.

She is very happy and grateful with the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the training imparted at the meetings has helped her better organize her business.  With respect to the communal bank she belongs to, it’s very committed and responsible.

Puente Alto is a commune in north Santiago, Chile’s capital.  It was founded as a small, rural town at the end of the 19th Century but due to its population growth it’s now one of the most populous communes in Chile with more than 600,000 residents.  It is the entry point to one of the metropolitan area’s foothill zones known as Cajón del Maipo, a zone with hiking trails, bridal paths and rafting, among other activities and also lodging and food services.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: El Porvenir De Junín (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal El Porvenir De Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de 11 socias y 2 socios que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es señora Nelly, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 6 años, los tres estudian  en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende ropa del todo tipo. Los fines de semana instala un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad aprovechando los días de feria que es cuando más vende, además en los días que no  son de feria vende la ropa puerta a puerta, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 8  años con su negocio y siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear  para comprar ropa sobretodo la ropa de temporada como: trajes de baño, bermudas y camisetas. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el Banco Comunal en el cual está muy contenta.
texts.en:
The “El Porvenir de Junín” (Junín’s Future) communal bank meets every two weeks in Junín Canton which is known for its kind and hardworking residents and because the best “aguardiente” [a distilled spirit] of the province and of Ecuador is distilled here.

The group has 11 women and 2 men who decided to join together to form this communal bank which will help them very much to improve their small businesses.  They carry out a variety of activities such as commerce, service and food sales, among others.

One of the members of this group is Nelly, 29.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 10, 8 and 6 years old; all three attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a great housewife who is also a merchant; she sells all types of clothes.  On the weekend she sets up a small stand downtown taking advantage of market days which is when she sells the most.  On non-market days she sells door to door.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise each time she needs it.  She’s had her business 8 years and has always done very well.

She will use this loan to buy clothes especially seasonal items like: bathing suits, Bermuda shorts and t-shirts.  Her goal is to continue forward with her business and in the communal bank where she’s very happy.

loans.use: to buy bathing suits, Bermuda shorts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Erika Lizbeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Erika es socia del banco comunal Tomebamba, vive en un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de todos quienes la visitan, su gente es muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Erika tiene 18 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido una niña de 5 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como obrero en una fábrica de calzado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Erika hace 6 meses se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa atreves de catalogo, realiza los pedidos con anticipación y sus clientes le pagan a plazos. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the “Tomebamba” communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca which is the country’s third most important city and since December, 1999, has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  It has a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of whoever visits.  Its residents are very hardworking, tenacious and enterprising.  They keep the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Erika is 18 years old and is in a common law relationship; she has a 5-month-old daughter.  Her husband works as a laborer in a shoe factory.  She does not have a house of her own; she a renter.

Erika has been selling all types of clothes for the last six months.  She places prior orders and her customers repay her in installments.  She’s in the second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy clothes to stock her inventory.  Her goal is to have a locale to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Tomebamba, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, parroquia que se encuentra localizada a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca. En su entorno se encuentran grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Doña María tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en colegio y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y de su familia, y como pasa en casa cría ganado, borregos, gallinas, gansos y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras que son para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de un becerro para criarlo. 

Su sueño es comprarse un terreno en la ciudad.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Tomebamba” communal bank.  She lives in Cumbe Parish which is located 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca.  Around it are large grasslands with large cattle ranches, old haciendas and some modern buildings.  Its residents are nice and kind and they maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 36 years old, married and has four children who are 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old.  Her oldest daughter works and helps her out economically.  Two of her children are in secondary school and the youngest attends the little local elementary school.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and the house she lives in is hers.

María takes care of her home and family and since she spends her time at home she also raises cattle, sheep, chickens, geese and guinea pigs that she sells whenever she has an economic need.  She also farms vegetables to sell and for household consumption.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy a calf to raise.  Her dream is to buy a piece of property in the city.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Susana Del Socorro

texts.es: Susana Del Socorro es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio de la venta de elotes y además tiene también la venta y compra de cerdos estos negocios los tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y también lo realiza de forma ambulante. Ella tiene años de experiencia en ambas negocios, siempre esta innovando en su negocio ya que tiene un objetivo en la vida de crecer. Susana ya es clienta de Fundación León 2000, en cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con ganas de seguir adelante es muy perseverante. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar cerdos y abastecerse de producto.
texts.en:
Susana Del Socorro is an entrepreneur who started her own business selling corn, but she also buys and sells pigs. She manages these businesses from her home, but she also works as a traveling merchant. Susana has years of experience in both businesses and is always looks for ways to innovate because her goal is to grow in life.

Susana is already a client of Fundación León 2000 and has demonstrated that she is a responsible person. With her earnings, she has been able to continue moving forward with great perseverance. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy pigs so that she can restock her inventory.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food to sell

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Tomebamba, vive en un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de todos quienes la visitan, su gente es muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 60 años, es madre soltera de 10 hijos, ocho de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría animales como: ganado, cuyes y gallinas. También trabaja en la agricultura  y lo  que cosecha es  para su consumo y para la venta. 

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado. 

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Tomebamba” communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca which is the country’s third most important city and since December, 1999, has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  It has a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of whoever visits.  Its residents are very hardworking, tenacious and enterprising.  They keep the cultures and traditions of their peoples.

María is 60 years old and the single mother of ten children.  Eight of her children are married and live on their own and her two single children work and help her out economically; the house she lives in is hers.

María does her household chores and since she spends her time at home she also raises animals like cattle, guinea pigs and chickens.  She also farms; what she harvests is for her own consumption and to sell.

She’s in the second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy livestock.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Marion I.

texts.en:
Marion, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is presented to you in this photo. She is 45 years old and married to a civil servant. The couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary school. A native of Kambia town, Marion has been a professional teacher for the past 26 years.

Marion is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children. At the end of each month, she will repay the loan using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Ununiop Group

texts.en:
Salma is in her late 50s and is single. For the past 30 years, she has been a food vendor who works from seven in the morning through two in the afternoon to make a small monthly profit. Salma takes care of her relatives.  She will share her loan with her loan group, "Ununio," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.

Salma is requesting her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her stock of ingredients and products to sell more food. She successfully repaid her previous loans and used her loans to sell juice, water, and sodas and to pay for household expenses.  Salma's dream is to one day be able to buy a fridge and sell cold drinks.

loans.use: to increase her stock and sell more food

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia  inicia sus actividades a las 7 de la mañana ofreciendo sus bebidas tales como jugos, gaseosas, agua y comestibles como cosa de horno  en las diferentes unidades de buses interurbanos y a todo el público en general finalizando sus labores a las 5 de la tarde.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra  de gaseosas, jugos vareados, agua y cosa de horno, este crédito le ayudará a mejorar en su actividad, ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de bebidas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Eugenia starts her activities at 7 in the morning offering beverages like juices, soft-drinks, water and foodstuffs like baked goods on various interurban buses and to the general public; she stops working at 5 in the afternoon.

The loan will help her buy soft-drinks, assorted juices, water and baked goods; it will help her improve her activity and offer her customers a wider variety of beverages and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, assorted juices, water and baked goods.

loans.name: Yasmin Esperanza

texts.es:
Yasmin Esperanza es  soltera y se dedica a la actividad de venta de cosméticos  y otros productos de aseo personal como cremas corporales, shampoo, perfumes. Empieza su actividad comercial desde las 6 de la mañana ofreciendo sus productos de primera necesidad a usuarios del transporte intermunicipal de la ciudad de León que es donde ella vive.

 La señora Yasmin utilizará el crédito solicitado para la compra de uniformes escolares, cuadernos, lapiceros ya que se acerca la temporada en la que los estudiantes entraran a clases. También comprará las cremas corporales así como el shampoo. La señora Yasmin está sumamente agradecida con Ceprodel por el apoyo que  obtendrá del crédito puesto que este le será de mucha bendición para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Yasmin Esperanza is single and sells cosmetics and other personal hygiene products like body creams, shampoo and perfume.  She starts her commercial activity at 6 in the morning offering her basic need items to passengers on inter-municipal buses in the city of León which is where she lives.

Yasmin will use the loan to buy school uniforms, notebooks and mechanical pencils because the season when students start classes is approaching.  She will also buy body creams and shampoo.  Yasmin is extremely grateful to Ceprodel for the support she’ll get from the loan because it will be a great blessing for her development.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Josefa De Jesús

texts.es:
Josefa de Jesús es  casada y se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras ofreciendo su producto en el mercado la terminal. Inicia sus labores desde las 5:00 de la mañana y finalizándolas a las 6:00 de la tarde.

La señora Josefa de Jesús utilizará el crédito solicitado para la compra de plátano, chayotes, yuca, cebollas, quequisque, tomates, zanahorias, azúcar, arroz, aceite, frijoles, jabón, ace, cloro y especies al por mayor.

La señora Josefa está sumamente agradecida con Ceprodel por el apoyo que obtendrá del crédito puesto que este le será de mucha bendición para su desarrollo.
texts.en: Josefa de Jesús is married and works selling vegetables at the market at the bus station.  She starts work at 5am and finishes at 6pm.  She will use the requested loan to buy bananas, chayote, manioc, onions, “quequisque” [starchy tuber], tomatoes, carrots, sugar, rice, oil, beans, soap, Ace brand detergent and spices at wholesale.  Josefa is extremely grateful to Ceprodel for the support she’ll get from the loan because it will be a big blessing for her development.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Henrry Marcelino

texts.es: El socio Henrry Marcelino; continua con su trabajo en construcción en diferentes obras, el socio esta ahorrando dentro de sus grupo y paralelamente a esto juegan todos los miembros pandero que es un modo de ahorrar obligadamente y con el cero porciento de interes lo que a el le permite seguir creciendo, el socio desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de herramientas, el socio comprara nuevas herramientas como cerrucho, matillo, carretilla, taladro entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Henrry Marcelino continues with his work in construction at various job sites. The member is saving within his group and, in parallel fashion, along with all the members he participates in pandero [a cooperative savings program] which is a mandatory savings method with zero percent interest, which allows him to continue growing. 

The member wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of tools. He will buy new tools such as a handsaw, hammer, wheelbarrow and drills among others.

loans.use: to purchase new tools such as a handsaw, hammer, wheelbarrow and drill among others.

loans.name: Papa Moustapha

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est une jeune qui exerce le transport urbain par motocyclette.Il est dans ce métier depuis un an.Il est célibataire mai a la charge de ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et sœurs qui vont à l'école.Il est employé comme salarié par le propriétaire de la motocyclette qui lui remet chaque soir le tiers de la recette journalière.Ce modeste montant lui permet tant bien que mal de supporter les dépenses d'alimentation de la famille et les frais scolaires de ses frères et sœurs.Aujourd'hui, il voudrait acquérir sa propre moto et maximiser ainsi ses revenus.C'est pour cela qu'il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter une nouvelle motocyclette.Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young men who provides motorcycle transportation services in the city. He's been doing this job for one year. He's single, but has to support his two parents and his siblings, who attend school.

He's employed for a wage by the owner of the motorcycle, who gives him every evening one third of the daily takings. This small amount of money more or less enables him to cover the family's food expenses, and the school expenses of his siblings.

At this time, he would like to purchase his own motorcycle, and thus maximize his income. For this reason, he's seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 in order to purchase a new motorcycle. He ambitions to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mass

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mass est un jeune marchand d’œufs  âgé de 34 ans, célibataire, sans enfants. Il a une expérience de quatre ans dans ce domaine.
Avec le crédit, il envisage d’acheter 125 plateaux d’œufs à 1650fcfa le plateau afin de l’écouler dans le marché local.
Monsieur Mass n’a pratiquement pas de charges sinon sa restauration ; ce qui lui permet d’épargner  pour  pouvoir réaliser son vœu.
Ses projets pour l’avenir seraient d’avoir son propre poulailler de poulets pondeurs et d’y associer la vente d’aliments bétails.
texts.en:
Mr. Mass, aged 34, is a young unmarried merchant who sells eggs. He has four years of experience in this domain. With this loan, he envisions buying 125 trays of eggs at 1,650 francs CFA per tray in order to sell them at the local market. 

Mr. Mass has practically no expenses except for his restaurant, which enables him to save money to realize his dream. 

His projects for the future would be to have his own chicken coop for egg-laying hens and to include the sale of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy eggs to resell at the local market

loans.name: Cirjano Raul

texts.es:
Cirjano de 41 años, se dedica a realizar el servicio e mecánico en mantenimiento de moto taxis y autos de las distintas marcas y modelos vigentes en el Perú, se dedica a esta actividad hace aproximadamente 2 años, en este lapso de tiempo hasta la actualidad, la cantidad de moto taxis se han incrementado y fue este uno de los motivos por el que Cirjano se entusiasmo y decidió brindar este tipo de servicio a los ciudadanos de Pisco, provincia que fue azotada en el año 2007 por un terrible terremoto, noticia que fue difundida a nivel mundial por la cantidad de daños y pérdidas que sufrió dicha ciudad.

Por suerte, Cirjano ya sabía cómo reparar este tipo de vehículos porque tomo cursos especiales y esto le ha ayudado mucho a desarrollarse profesionalmente en este ámbito, el trabaja día a día con la finalidad de lograr tener los ingresos necesarios para su esposa y su menor hijo, esta labor es muy esforzada y es por eso que siempre termina muy sucio, aún así continúa y continúa.

Cirjano desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo y así el pueda adquirir una máquina de soldar y un taladro, los mismo que le facilitaran el trabajo debido a que los suyos ya son muy viejitos y ya no puede darle el mismo uso de antes, Cirjano sabe que con esta ayuda el podrá agilizar y mejorar su trabajo permitiéndose atender a muchos más clientes y asegurarse de que estos regresaran. Este hombre se siente muy agradecido con Dios por la oportunidad que le brindan de progresar no solo como ser humano sino también que su familia continuará desarrollándose. Su gran meta por ahora es poder brindarle mayores comodidades a su familia y hacer que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Cirjano is 42 and works as mechanic, maintaining mototaxis and various makes and models of cars found in Peru. He has had this livelihood for approximately two years. In this period of time and until now, the quantity of mototaxis has increased, and this was one of the reasons why Cirjano got excited about the idea and decided to offer this type of service to the citizens of Pisco.

This province was hit with a terrible earthquake in 2007; news that spread around the world because of the amount of damage and loss that the city suffered. Luckily Cirjano already knew how to repair this type of vehicle, because he took special courses, and this has really helped him to develop professionally in this field.

He works day after day, with the aim of managing to have the income necessary for his wife and minor child. This work is very hard, and that is why he always ends up very dirty. Even so, he keeps on going. 

Cirjano hopes the Kiva lenders can help him, so he can acquire a welding machine and a drill. These will make the work easier, due to the fact that his own are now very old, and he can't give them the same use as before. Cirjano knows that with this help, he will be able to speed up and improve his work, allowing him to serve many more clients, and ensuring that they come back.

This man feels very grateful to God for the opportunity he is being offered to progress; not only as a human being, but also in the sense that his family will continue to move forward.

His great goal for now is to be able to provide greater comfort to his family and to have his son be a fine professional.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and a drill.

loans.name: Gie Dinguiraye Youssoupha 2 Group

texts.fr: Le "GIE dinguiraye youssoupha 2" est constitué de deux jeunes femmes , mariées qui exercent le commerce de produits alimentaires. Le chef du groupe(en blanc), est mère de deux enfants, dont l'un fréquente l'école primaire. Chaque matin, elle arpente les rues de sa ville, pour proposer à domicile du lait caillé qu'elle transporte dans un grand bocal posé sur sa tête.Les recettes qu'elle obtient lui permettent d'acheter du riz, du poisson et d'autres condiments pour préparer le déjeuner , une fois revenu chez elle, au milieu de la journée.Pour augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les deux femmes sollicitent un prêt de 250 000f afin d'acheter des sacs de lait en poudre.Leur ambition est de s'installer au marché central de leur ville.
texts.en:
The group "GIE dinguiraye youssoupha 2" is comprised of two young married women who work selling food. The head of the group (in white) is the mother of two children, one of whom attends primary school.
