She has insufficient funds now so she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy boxes, frames, slippers, bags and accessories to sell. She would like to sell more items to improve her business and to be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy boxes, frames, slippers, bags and accessories to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old and is married to a farmer. Vilma also helps her spouse in planting and harvesting rice to sell. They have been in this business for almost 15 years. Vilma usually earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season. It usually falls during the month of April and November. 

Vilma has three children. Two of them go to school. She aims to educate them up to college so that they earn a degree. According to her, she needs to strengthen her business to meet her goal. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

Hopefully, she will have good financial management to make her family financially stable so that they will not have to borrow from traders or neighbors to finance their crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
In order to further increase the number of crops, Jovita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farming business. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. She aims to have a comfortable life with her family someday, that’s why she is hard-working and persistent in developing their source of income. 

Hopefully, with her loan and hard work, she can easily achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farming business

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 29 years of age and has been in farming for three years since marrying Reny. They are blessed with three children. She is very dedicated to farming because she didn’t finish her education. If she cannot work, they would feel the agony of being poor. And she doesn’t want her family to suffer from that difficulty.


To avoid this, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the development of her farming business. She just hopes to attain abundant crops by next crop season to have a comfortable and contented life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the development of her farming business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 58 years old, a mother of four children. Aside from working inside the house, she also invests time in helping her husband in their corn field. She wants to make sure that it will provide a good profit in the next crop season.


Her willingness to expand their corn field led her to request a loan of P15,000  to buy corn seed, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs needed in planting corn. She knows that this loan will help to improve their business and their living situation as well.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs needed in planting corn.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila is 47 years old and has three children.  She is married to Donato, a farmer in their village. To make a productive profit, she also helps her spouse in farming activities such as planting and harvesting corn. Their income serves as their maintenance for their daily needs and the allowance of her child. 


She wants to have an abundant harvest by next cropping season so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow. Hopefully, she can attain her objective so that her family will be financially problem free.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of hens.

loans.name: Khoy

texts.en:
Khoy, age 56, sells cows. He buys cows from his village and nearby districts and raises them at home. When the cows are fully grown, he sells them to a middleman who comes to buy at his home. His wife, Sokleang, age 55, is a commune leader assistant. 

They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and the other one is in school. 

Khoy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional cows to raise.

loans.name: C9255 Abishyishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Fred is 43 years old and is married with four children between the ages of ten and twelve.  His business is well organized, he sells sorghum, beans and maize.  His business starts from 7 until 12 every day with two years of experience.

Fred has requested a loan from Kiva loan partner Vision Finance company in order to expend his business by buying more beans, maize and sorghum to sell. With the profits from the loan, Fred will be able to reinvest in his business and to save for future.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: C8039 Wisigarinyumamubyeyi Group

texts.en:
Vanessa is 33 years old and is married with one child who is ten years old.  Vanessa sells Irish potatoes and bananas in her business and she works from 6am until 5pm every day.  Vanessa is the first person on the left side.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance company in order to increase her business by buying more Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.  With the profits, Vanessa will renovate her house, save money, reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: C8028 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
James is 54 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 15 and 19 years old.  James sells beans.  His business is well organized, he employes three people to help him and starts from 10am until 5pm every day, with five years of experience.  He is the president of this group, which is called "C8028 Twisungane" and is the first person on the right side.

James has requested a loan from Kiva lender via Vision Finance company in order to purchase more beans to sell.  With this profit, James will be able to save money for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: C8038 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Therese is 35 years old and is married with four children between the age of one and eight years.  Therese sells beans.  She is the president in this group which is called "C8038 Abadahemuka".  Her business is well organized, she employs one person to help her and works from 6am until 1pm every day, with five years of experience.

Therese has requested a loan from Kiva lender via Vision Finance company in order to purchase more beans to sell.  With this profit, Therese will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: C2399 Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Jean d'Arc is 26 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. Jean d'Arc sells rice, soap, salt, sugar, beans, etc. She is the president of this group called "C2399 Zamuka" Her business is well organized. She employes one person to help her and starts from 5:30 am until 8:30 pm every day. She has three years of experience. 

Jean d'Arc has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of rice, sugar, soap, salt and beans to sell. With this profit, Jean d'Arc will reinvest in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, soap, salt, sugar, etc to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 47 years old.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 16 years. Her business is well-organized.  She sells charcoal and works from 6am until 7pm every day.  Jacqueline employs three people to help her.  She has three years of experience in her businesss.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. With this profit from the loan, Jacqueline will be able to buy more food for her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: C8036 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Venansia is 24 years old. She is married and has two children between the ages of 2 and 3 years.  Venansia sells meat. She employs two people to help her and works from 6am until 6pm every day. She has two years of experience in her business. She is the presidente of this borrowing team, which is called "C8036 Turwanyubukene" in the local language.

Venansia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more quantities of meat to sell.   With this profit, Venansia will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: C8037 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Jules is 24 years old.  He is married and has one child who is 3 years old. His business is well-organized.  He sells clothes and works from 6am until 5pm every day.   Jules is the team leader of this group, which is called "C8037 Duteraninkunga" in the local language.  He is the first person on the right side.

Jules has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell.  With this profit, he will pay his children's school fees, renovate his house, buy food for his family and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: C9272 Itezimberemugore Group

texts.en:
Marie is 30 years old and a widow with two children between the ages of 7 and 10 years old. Her business is well organized. She employs one person to help her and operates from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She has three years of experience.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more fruits and vegetables to sell. With the profits from the loan, Marie will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: C8026 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. He sells Fanta, milk, tea, and beer in his business, which is open from 6 am until 7 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. He is the leader of his group, which is called "C8026 Tuzamurane" in the local language. He is in the middle on the left side. Jean Paul has three years of experience in this business.

Jean Paul has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of Fanta, milk, tea, and beer to sell. With this profit, Jean Paul will save money for the future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: C9226 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Elias is 59 years old. He is married and has no children. He sells animals, like cows and goats, and his business is open from 6am until 1pm every day. He is the leader of the group, which is called "C9226 Twisungane" in the local language. In the photo, Elia is the first person shown on the right side. Elias has two years of experience. 

Elias has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more goats and cows to sell. With the profits, he will be able to reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old, married, and a farmer living in the Philippines. With her spouse, she raises rice crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. For an additional income, Alma also raises pigs and chickens in their backyard for future sales.
 
Alma has four children. She is untiringly involved in this business to generate an income to provide a good education for them. As of now, she has insufficient funds in her farming business so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. 

Alma is hoping that this coming harvest season of April, her crop will produce abundantly to make her farming business more profitable and save for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of San Esteban. She had been married for almost 10 years and has no children yet, but she is hoping to soon. They have a farming business that serves as their primary source of income. Her spouse does farming activities such as tilling, sowing, and transplanting rice crops in the field. She also helps her spouse do these activities.

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to strengthen her business. She will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to sustain her crops. She is hoping that she could make her crops productive and improve their farming practices in order to achieve their dream goal of economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to sustain her crops.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 56 years old and still single. She is residing in the peaceful village of San Esteban. She has a farming business and has raised crops for almost 20 years. This serves as her income. Though she lives alone, she also helps her niece and nephews for their daily allowances in school. 

As of now, she had insufficient funds to use in her business. She is asking for P10,000 to buy seeds to grow and to pay for laborers to transplant the rice seedlings.

In the future, she would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur and achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow and to pay for laborers to transplant the rice seedlings

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a patient and helpful resident of San Esteban. She is 51 years old and married. She has three children, all have settled into marriage and live separately. She and her husband are both involved in rice farming. Upon maturity of the crops, they sell them to traders in the nearby village. 

She would like to make her crop more productive, but she has insufficient capital now. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hybrid rice seeds and urea (a fertilizer) to use in farming.

As she grows older, Natividad still aspires to keep obtaining enough income to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy hybrid rice seeds and fertilizer to use in farming

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is now 26 years old. She is married and had one child. Marilyn did not finish her college education and was engaged into early marriage. She was married to a farmer, and they are both involved in the farming business to generate an income. They have been cultivating a half-hectare rice field for almost five years. They earn a yield twice a year during the harvest months of April and November. The income from this business is just enough for their daily meals, electric bills and other basic kitchen needs.

She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor cost in farming. Additional laborers are an expense for them, but they need to pay the laborers who helped transplant rice seedlings in the field.

With all her hard work and sacrifices, Marilyn hopes to lift her family out from their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Elianor

texts.en:
Elianor is 42 years old, married and has four children. She is married to an industrious farmer in their village. Rice farming is the family's primary source of income. They have been planting and harvesting rice since they got married 15 years ago. The couple is proud enough that income through farming has provided enough sustenance for the family such as delicious meals and daily allowances for her children.

Elianor and her husband still aim that someday they can improve their farming output to make their family more economically stable. As of now, they have insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. Hopefully, the additional inputs will make their crop productive and be able to generate more income to save for the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a farmer living in the Philippines. He owns a one-hectare rice field located about a 15-minute walk from his house. Farming is what occupies his daily routine. He goes down to the field early in morning to ensure good growth of his crop. From the last harvest of November, he was able to earn PHP 20,000. This was used for daily meals and bills at home. 

Mario is 56 years old, married and has three children. All his children have been sent to college through his income from the farming business. As of now, he has insufficient funds to buy four bags of rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizer to maintain his crop. He is asking for PHP 20,000 to continuously generate good income from his crop.

Someday, Mario hopes to keep earning funds to save for future expenses so that he will no longer rely on his children's remittances.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
At his age of 41, Ignacio still works hard in planting and harvesting rice on his two-hectare rice field. He had been doing it for almost 20 years. Ignacio is an experienced farmer but according to him, he still needs to improve his farming business so that he can save enough funds for the college education of his three children who are still in secondary education.

Ignacio plans to make his business more profitable so he is asking for additional capital to buy three bags of urea and magnum (fertilizer and insecticide) to use in farming. He is asking for PHP 15,000.

Hopefully, he can reach his goal in making his family live fortunately.

loans.use: to buy UREA and MAGNUM (fertilizer and insecticide)

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino is 44 years old, married and has three children. He is a farmer living in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper and also helps him in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm. The couple have been in this business for almost 10 years.

Now he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Quirino would like to strengthen his farming business to support his children's education and for his family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a proud farmer who raises crops for the sustenance of his family. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He owns a one-hectare rice field and has been cultivating it for 20 years. Through his income, he has been able to send his three children to college education and to earn their degrees. He has four children and his youngest child is still studying for a degree. 

He is asking for a loan so that he will continuously strengthen his farming business for the family's welfare. He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for the maintenance of his crop.

With all his patience, sacrifices and faith in God, Alfredo would like to provide a successful life for his family from his farming activities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for the maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 39 years of age, married and has four children. She is in the business of selling fish and has been in this kind of business for more than three years. She loves her work so much because it is a great help in improving their poor living. For the three years of operations, she has kept her business going and is trying to spread out.

For her to expand her business and to earn a higher income, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP (pesos) to buy fish and new Styrofoam (to place her fish to sell).  Hopefully, she will receive an appropriate and good profit as she uses her loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and new Styrofoam

loans.name: C18522 Icyerekezo Group

texts.en:
Valentine is 38 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 11 years old. Valentine sells clothes. Her business is well organized. She employs one person to help her and she operates from 7 am until 6 pm every day. She has five years of experience. Valentine is on a borrowing team, which is called "C18522 Icyerekezo" in the local language.

Valentine has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With the profit, Valentine will be able to reinvest in her business and save money.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: C6408 Indatwa Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and is married with one child who is four years old. He sells items such as rice, soap, Irish potatoes, sugar, juice, water, etc. His business is well organized. He employs one person to help him and works from 7am until 5pm every day. Emmanuel has three years of experience in this business. He is the president of this group which is colled "C6408 Indatwa" in the local language. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lender, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more general store items (sugar, rice, soap, Irish potatoes, etc.) to sell. With the profit from the loan, Emmanuel will buy food for his family, will renovate his house and pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more general store items (sugar, rice, soap, Irish potatoes, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Ronalenne

texts.en:
A sari-sari (variety) store in their village has been Ronalenne’s business concern for the past five years. She sells commodities like sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, salt, rice, milk and junk food. She is focused on her business because this is her only way to help her husband to support their only child. 

As time passes and her child grows, her necessities for living also grow. So Ronalenne needs to double her earnestness. In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos to buy soft drinks and bread as additional commodities to sell. She hopes to gain more profits through these goods in order for her to provide for her child's needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bread as additional commodities to sell

loans.name: Nenda

texts.en:
Nenda is 31 years old, married and has four children. She sells fish as a source of income. She patiently sells everyday to avoid insufficiency. With four children, she says that it is costly, especially when they go on to study. So as early as now, Nenda wants to save and invest in the bank enough funds for her children. To acquire her wish, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos to buy fish as additional goods to sell.

She hopes that through her hard work, she will easily attain her dream.

loans.use: to buy fish as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: C18521 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Venantiel is 33 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 8 years old. She sells shoes in her business which is open from 7am until 6pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. She is the leader of the group which is called "C18521 Tuzamurane" in the local language. Venantiel has 10 years of experience in this business.

Venantiel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With the profit, Venantiel will save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years of age, married and has three children. She has been in the hog raising business for over two years. She is a very hard-working woman because, aside from the hog raising business, she sells fish as an additional source of income. She works in these activities in order to earn a better income to pay for her children’s education costs.

Elisa is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs, and fish to sell.  She hopes to raise healthy pigs so she can sell them for a high price and to sell many fish as well. Elisa is very motivated to work because of her children who serve as her inspiration.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs, and fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 36 years old and has a sari-sari store (a local convenience shop). She had her business for one year. It is located in her home and offers commodities such as sugar, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce and beverages.

Her husband also manages their small farm land as additional source of income. Together they run their own business so as to provide for the needs of her two children and make some improvements to their house.

To help her achieve her dream, Rosemary has asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 so that she can purchase additional products for her store. This will allow her to offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store so she can give her customers more variety.

loans.name: C6313 Imbaraga Group

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 33 years old and is married with a three-year-old child. His business is well organized. In his small shop he sells different goods including juice, rice, soap, salt etc. He works from 7am until 5pm every day. Jean de Dieu employes four people to help him, and they have three years experience.  

Jean de Dieu is the president of this group which is colled "C6313 Imbaraga" in the local language. In the photo, he is the person with the raised hand. 

Jean de Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through the Vision Finance Company in order to purchase rice, soap, salt, sugar, etc to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as soap, rice, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: C18523 Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is 40 years old and is married with three children who are aged between 8 and 15 years old. She has had a sewing business for 10 years which is well organized. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. and employs six people to help her. Jeannette is the leader of a borrowing team which is called "C18523 Abizerwa" in the local language and she is the first person on the left side of the photo.

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva field partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase an additional sewing machine. If she is able to realize additonal profit as a result of this loan, Jeannette hopes to open up other outlets of her business in the area and to save money for her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a patient farmer who grows rice in his one-hectare rice field as the source of his income. He has been patiently doing farming activities such as planting and harvesting rice for almost 15 years. Edgar is 48 years old and has three children that attend school. His goal is to educate them up to college to have a brighter future someday.

As of now, he has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

Hopefully, he could improve his farming practices and increase his income for the development of his business and their lives as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 46 years old, married, and has seven children. He raises crops- primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. He had been in the farming business for almost 20 years. He owns a half-hectare rice field. Through his income from this business, he provides daily allowances and meals for the family. Four of his children are still studying while the rest are employed and sometimes help him shoulder the family's expenses.  

As of now, he would like to make his business more profitable so he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow.

In the future, Ricardo would like to keep earning good profits from his business to make his family economically stable and to not rely on his children's remittances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 31 years old and has one child. She is married to Noel, a tricycle operator near their place of residence. To add to her spouse's income, she is selling personal products. Her  most likely customers are her neighbors, friends and relatives. With her income of P6,000 monthly, she is able to pay the electric bills and cover the daily allowance of her child who is in elementary school.  

Lilibeth would like to expand her business and sell more products to increase her earnings so she is asking for additional capital of P25,000 to buy colognes, shampoo, deodorant, lotions, and makeup to sell. 

Lilibeth would like to keep earning funds for the college education of her child to have a brighter future someday. She also hopes that their businesses will become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy colognes, shampoo, deodorant, lotions, and makeup to sell

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and one child. He is a farmer who raises and sells corn from his farmland. He has 10 years of experience in crop raising and he can say that this activity is quite challenging, expensive, and difficult. But despite of these hindrances, he’s has not softened --  instead it serves as his inspiration to continue farming.

He also found a partner who assists him in farming. He requested a loan of 15,000 pesos from Alalay sa kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers -- essential inputs in farming. He looks forward to the productive outcome of his farm and for the improvement of their living situation.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo just finished his high school education and never pursued college life due to poverty. As a result, he had to learn his parent's livelihood and that is the farming business. Right now, he has been engaged in cultivation of agricultural crops for over 20 years. This is his main source of income for his wife and one child.

Last crop, he earned about P10,000 and he spent the proceeds on the needs of the family. He wants to exceed this in order to give his family a more comfortable life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and to pay the co-workers for planting. He looks forward to an abundant harvest in the next crop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and to pay workers for planting

loans.name: C6203 Amahoro Group

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old and married with three children between the age of 4 and 19. She sells bananas and her business is open from 6 am until 5 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. Esther is the leader of the group which is called "C6203 Amahoro" in the local language. In the photo, she is the second person on the left side. She has four years of experience. 

Esther has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of bananas to sell. With this profit, she will save money for her future and pay her children's school fess.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of bananas.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 40 years-old and married. She has two children. To gain an income, she has operated a retail store for almost 10 years. She is very thankful that her income from selling grocery items to her neighborhood allows her to save for daily needs of her children. According to her, the income is just enough for the family's sustenance but she still needs to improve her business to earn funds for future expenses of the family. 

She is now borrowing a loan of P16,000 in order to buy canned goods, soft drinks, instant noodles and soap to sell. These items would help increase her sales capacity. Hopefully, Lerma can reach her goal of improving the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, instant noodles and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel, a 32-year-old man from the village of Burgos, province of Isabela, is married with one daughter. He is a man with patience and determination according to his wife, Robenita. Rodel is requesting a loan of P 25,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farm business. Aside from farming he is also engaged in raising livestock such as piggery and poultry.

In the future, Rodel hopes that he can supply the necessities for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow on his farm.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en: Herminigildo, a 46 year-old man full of love and determination for his family need, is married to Mildred. He makes sure that he can provide for the daily needs of his family. That's why he is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy a sack of fertilizer and rice seeds for his farm business. Aside from farming, he is also engaged in pig fattening. Herminigildo hopes that someday he can give a higher quality of life to his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow on his farm

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 35 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his two grown children in the village of Burgos, Province of Isabela. He is engaged in agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Ruel has worked in agriculture growing rice for the last ten years. He purchases his supplies in the town of Ilagan, and sells his products in the market there.

The requested loan is for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. The loan will help him to increase his income for use by his family and for investment. His dream is to buy a plot of land that he can continue to plant on.

In his free time, he really enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Lary

texts.en:
Due to a lack of job opportunities, Lary raises hogs and grows rice to support his family. This 33-year-old father of one school-age child plans to improve upon his sources of income to satisfy his family's needs and provide them with a better future. Despite problems and calamities that naturally occur in their lives, he can still manage the business.

Now requesting a loan of P10,000 to improve his hog-raising business, Lary will use the money to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will be able to make the business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Cristelyn

texts.en:
Cristelyn is 25 years old and still single. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she is raises hogs to earn an income and to save for her future. She plans to help her parents to finance the education of her younger sisters and to become financially stable before she gets married. She aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income and satisfy their needs.

To accomplish her plan, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She mentions that the loan will help her to improve her business, and she hopes that she will be successful in carrying out her plan.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Aries

texts.en:
Aries, 32, lives with Luz and they have two grown-up-children. They live in their own home in the community of Burgos, in Isabela province. Aries is a very hardworking man. He farms two parcels of land, cultivating corn and rice. The Burgos area is highly sought after because the land and climate are very good for growing. Every year, Aries harvests 17,000 kilos, which he successfully sells in the city of Ilagan, Isabela. Aries enjoys his work because he can be more independent and, most of all, because his income depends upon his own efforts. In order to facilitate his work, he hires people to help him plant his crops. 

Next month, Aries is planning to plant other products, such as vegetables, on land rented from neighbors or friends. He will be responsible for making his payments on time. Aries will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds to grow and to pay workers to clear and cultivate his lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: " Patience plus hard work is the key to success," according to Leonard, 29 years old. He and his wife, Giovannie, have two grown-up children. Leonard is engaged in farming,  raising crops such as rice and corn. He works hard to achieve his goals, especially to meet his family's needs. Leonard is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds to plant on his farm. Leonard hopes that he can provide quality living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sacks of rice and corn seeds

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 49 years old, the father of five children. His farm is the family's primary source of income. The proceeds from each harvest go to pay for his children's tuition fees, commodities, and daily allowances. Unfortunately, his profit of 10,000 pesos from the last harvest is not enough to meet their needs. Without financial assistance, he will be unable to continue his business. For this reason, he requests a loan of 25,000 pesos to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use on his farmland.

Alexander hopes to grow healthier crops to produce greater profits, which would allow him to finish paying for his children's education and to start expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo, 37 years old, is married and lives with his son and his wife, who are his number-one priority. With the requested loan of PHP 25,000 he intends to buy supplies like seeds and fertilizer to keep his rice and corn fields in optimal condition. 

His goal is to keep his crops in the best condition possible so that the next harvest will have a greater yield of corn and rice and an improved output. His goal is to improve his crops in order to earn more income and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 52 years old and married. He has one child. He is a farmer in their village, where he plants and harvests rice in his one-hectare field. After the crops mature, he sells them to traders. He has been farming for seven years now.

He would like to make his business more profitable, so he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for use in farming.

In the future, Rodolfo would like to produce a better yield with every harvest season to boost his profits so he can educate his child and someday provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano, 49 years old, is married to Flora and they live in the community of Burgos, in Isabela province. Luciano has been farming for eight years and employs two people.  He grows crops, rears chickens and fattens pigs. 

Luciano hopes to expand his farm in the future. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 28 years old and has one school-aged child. Due to life hardships, she wants to improve her hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for almost two years and usually earns a profit of PHP 6,000 a month, which she usually spends on the family's food and their child's allowance. 

Genelyn wants to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She believes that the loan will help her to improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future. She hopes that someday, the family will improve their status of living and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is 32 years old and from the village of Burgos, an area mostly engaged in agriculture. Unable to find sufficient financial means to cultivate the land, Jonathan has applied for a loan. With the help of this loan, Jonathan hopes to receive a good harvest with his next crop and to increase his income. This will allow him to save money for further development of his agricultural business and also to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo, 51 years old, is married to Rosemarie. He lives in Burgos, Isabela province with his family. Ever since he was little, Edgardo has worked with his family growing crops such as corn and rice.  He is a very hardworking person.

Edgardo currently has one hectare where he grows corn and rice, which he sells at the local market. However, the buyers often come to his house. Edgardo is motivated with farming because his product is in great demand and he gets a good income.

Edgardo has requested this loan of PHP 25,000 to invest in planting corn and rice and to expand more land. He will use the loan to pay the day workers and to buy fertilizers and seed for the crop. His plan is to improve production and to continue getting income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 25, married and has one infant-age child. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village. They aim to improve their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to support their family and save for future emergencies. They have been farmers for more than five years and usually earn a profit of P18,000 in every harvest season. They use this for their food, clothing and transportation.

To improve the business, Jocelyn is asking for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs required in her rice farming business. She mentioned that this loan will help a lot to improve the business and hopes that they will be having a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs required in her rice farming business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a patient mother of five. She is married to a farmer, and she also helps her spouse with farming activities such as planting and harvesting rice to sell. The couple have been doing this for almost 10 years. The one hectare rice field they cultivate was inherited from her in-laws. Rice farming is the family's primary source of income.

As of now, she has insufficient funds for maintenance of her crop, so she is borrowing a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming.

In the future, Lourdes would like to have better crop production for her family's welfare as well as her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides use in farming

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 43 years old and has been cultivating a one hectare rice field for six years. He plants and harvests rice to sell. Rice farming is Eduardo's primary source of income.
 
Eduardo lives alone. He is single and has no family to sustain. But according to him, he still wants to improve his farming business for an additional income. He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy urea (fertilizer) and hybrid seeds to grow. 

In the future, Eduardo would like to keep earning funds to use in times of emergency, especially when he gets old and weak.

loans.use: to buy urea (fertilizer) and hybrid seeds to grow

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria proves to be a responsible wife. She involves herself in farming activities to help her husband generate income for the family. With her husband, she plants and harvests rice to sell. They have been doing it for almost 20 years. The income from the business goes for meals, bills at home and school expenses. 

The couple has seven children. Four of them are still attending school, while the rest have found employment. Despite the large family, they each possess the determination to succeed in getting out of poverty. 

In order to make her crops productive, Gregoria is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. 

Gregoria hopes that she will make her family financially stable and continuously educate her children for better living conditions someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a responsible housewife who always helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a good harvest. They have three school-aged children and they want them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Despite the hardships and calamities they have encountered in farming, they have the strong determination to improve their farming business. 

They planned to expand their rice plantation to ensure a high production, but due to insufficient capital, Juanita is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs for transplanting rice. They are hoping that they will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season to be able to finance the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs for transplanting rice.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old and still single. She already earned a degree but due to lack of job opportunities, she helps her parents in managing their rice farming business to earn income for their daily living. She planned to earn and save more income to put up a business for her to manage in the future. 

To work out her plan, she aimed to improve their rice farming business to increase their yield and income this coming harvest season. She is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of their rice farming business. She believes that the loan will help them to make an improvement in their business and hopes that they will have a high production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming business.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en: Melchor, 42 years old, is a widower with one grown-up child. Melchor is engaged in a farming business with the help of his son. According to him, he does everything for his son because he promised his wife that he would take good care of him. That's why he works hard to achieve his son's dreams. Melchor is requesting a loan of  25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm. Melchor hopes that he can give his son everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
"A Hard-working woman", Reynalda, 42, is married and has two school-aged children. She is from the barangay (administrative division) of Burgos,  province on the Luzon islands. Reynalda runs a store from which she sells vegetables to the local community. Reynalda has been in business for over 21 years and earns approximately PHP 4,000 a month.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy squash, beans, leafy vegetable and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from the village of Burgos. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics and apparel products from AVON and Natasha Company in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years. 

Erlinda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as clothes, pants and make-up. Erlinda's goal is to continue working and increase her profits, so that she can have a good life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en:
Brigilda is a 39-year-old woman who sells various products in the community located in the village of Burgos, province of Isabela. She has ten years of experience in this field. Brigilda is married and has two grown-up children. 

Her monthly income from this business is P 3000. The types of products she sells are very popular and in high demand. She would like to expand her business and purchase more items and diversify the products she sells. For this purpose she applied for a P 25,000 loan. She has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, sugar, soap, noodles and spices for her store.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 50 years old and married with two children. He is in the business of farming and has been operating since 1980. He is very active and earns about P30,000 every crop season. But when he contracted polio, he neglected his business and was in trouble due to expenses for his medication. Despite his challenges, he hopes to prevail. With God’s mercy, he overcomes his difficulties.


Now that he has come through such a dilemma, he continues his farming business. The truth is, he is asking a loan of 25,000 pesos to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use to improve his business.  He hopes to gather a good harvest in the next crop season and with the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for emergency purposes and pay his younger child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use to improve his business.

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en: Malyn is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  She is from the village of Burgos, province of Isabela. Malyn owns and operates a business venture providing a motorcycle with a passenger cab in the community. She is requesting a loan of P 10,000 to purchase spare parts such as tire and oil for her motorcycle to have better quality of service in the people of the community. Malyn has been in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos per month. Malyn is a very patient and responsible person; not only for her family, but also in their community.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like tire,oil for her motorcycle used in her business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: A woman with determination in her work. Natividad is 58 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, she sells vegetables in the market. Natividad has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy different vegetables to offer to the community.

loans.use: to buy beans, squash, eggplant and bananas for her business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the village of Burgos, Isabela province. Her husband has a farming business. Merlyn started her pig farming business in early 2010 with only one pig and now she has three. Even though she is fairly new to the business, Merlyn has already found a buyer. Her business has the potential to grow. However, due to lack of experience, her farm is cold and she is short on food supply. Merlyn is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is a sharp and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena, 35 years old, lives in the village of Burgos with her four adult-aged children and her husband who works as an overseas worker. Lucena has operated a business selling consumables for more than five years. She has prospered in a big way and is remodeling her storefront. She does not pay for labor because her children do the work. She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory to stock her general store.

Lucena is a responsible woman who hopes to do well. She wants to continue investing in her business so that she can increase her sales and improve her finances. Lucena wants to finish her housing improvements and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods and spices for her store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is from the village of Burgos, Isabela province. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children. Elsie sells a variety of products, such as drinks, spices and soap. She started 2 years ago, when she inherited the business from her mother, who sold general merchandise. Elsie sells in a spot in the community. She took out this loan to buy additional products, such as spices, snack foods, drinks and candies, for her store. She will use the income generated from this loan to provide for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy spices, snack foods, drinks and candies for her store

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Having the determination to overcome poverty, Isabelita and her husband plan to expand their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to continue sending their two children to school. They have been farmers for almost 20 years and usually earn a profit of PHP 20,000 every harvest. They usually spend their income on food, clothing and allowances for their children. 

To ensure a high production, Isabelita is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in the rice farming business. They believe the loan will help them improve their business. They hope to have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for rice farming

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie operates a business selling a variety of products, such as soap, shampoo and snack foods. She buys good quality products at good prices from a nearby market. Rosemarie's husband works as a farmer. Rosemarie has four adult children.

With this new loan, Rosemarie will be able to buy more noodles, canned goods, spices and snack food products, which are in great demand this season. Her goal is to achieve more sales and make better profits, which will cover her basic and personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, spices and drinks for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, underwear, blouses, skirts, jackets and short pants to sell

loans.name: Augosto

texts.en: Augosto is a farmer. He is married and raising two children. Augosto had been planting and harvesting corn seeds to sell for almost 10 years. As of now, he would like to borrow 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow. He hopes to keep generating good income from his business and; therefore, lift his family from their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Ever since Marcelina, 39 years old, was very little, she really liked the art of welding, which is why she thought of having her own business making gates and windows. Her husband and daughter help her with the business, specifically with customer relations. Therefore, Marcelina does her work with great enthusiasm and dedication. In order to continue with her business, Marcelina wants a loan to buy hoses and a welding machine for her shop. Her big dream is to have a well-established business and a good quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her welding shop

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is 50 years old and married. He has three children, all of whom attend school. His family motivates him to improve his business and provide enough sustenance for them. Mariano is a farmer who has grown corn for almost 10 years, selling the crop to traders. 

Mariano is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to make his crop more productive. Through his determination and perseverance, Mariano will be able to educate his children up to college to earn degrees and to improve their living conditions someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is a patient mother of three. She is married to a farmer, whom she helps to plant and harvest corn to sell. The couple has been in this business for seven years and it is the family's primary source of income. Ofelia is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides. Ofelia would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 51 years old and married with six children, lives in the province of Isabela, which is a beautiful place. The people there raise animals and do farming. Her husband works as a farmer and the house they live in is their property. 

Avelina works as a furniture maker. That's why she is asking for a loan of P 8,000 for her furniture-making. Aside from the furniture business, she raises chickens and pigs, which she sells in the community. Her goal is to grow her furniture business.

loans.use: to buy a plane, wood and nails for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Bannuar

texts.en:
Bannuar, 38 years old, has been a hardworking farmer for almost 12 years. He is separated from his wife due to family conflicts and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, he aims to improve his rice farming business to support his two children. He wants them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. 

To ensure high production, Bannuar is asking for additional capital of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for his rice farm. Although sometimes there are natural calamities that come to destroy his crops, he has the strong determination to ensure high production. He hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for a rice farming business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is a housewife who also helps Deo (her spouse) in planting and harvesting corn to sell. The couple has three children and intend to provide a good education for them. Nena presently has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for farming. In the future, Nena would like to achieve a fruitful harvest and boost her profits to attain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is a hardworking father who raises crops, primarily by planting and harvesting corn seeds to sell. He had been doing it for almost 10 years. He usually earn about P10,000 in his one hectare corn field. 

He is now asking for a loan to make his crop productive every harvest season, so he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to use in farming. Hopefully, he can reach his goal in providing a good education for his children so they can earn a degree and have a better life someday.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to use in farming

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a responsible father who owns and manages a rice farming business in his village. He is now 53 years old and has two school-aged children. Despite the hardships of living, he has the determination to improve their standard of living and to educate his children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and usually earns a profit of 25,000 PHP in every harvest season. He uses his income for their daily living expenses and allowances of their children in school. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he needs to increase his income to cover his family's needs. He planned to expand his rice plantation to increase his yields. He is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for farming rice. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will make an improvement in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 43 years old, from the village of Bagong Silang, province of Isabela, and is married to Nestor. She lives in her own home with her life partner and three grown children. She has a wood lamination business that she attends to every day with dedication and kindness. Marilyn's business is located in a very rural area, where she is surrounded by many farms. In addition to this business, she has her own corn farm. Marilyn is an exemplary woman who never tires of working despite her advanced age. She has decided to request a loan of 11,000 PHP so the business will become stronger. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of wood, glue and other needs for wood lamination. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials for her wood lamination business

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
To survive from poverty, Renato aims to improve his rice farming business which is a major source of his income. He is 46 years old and has two school-aged children. He has cultivated his farmland for almost 20 years and produces an income of P23,000 in every harvest season. He aims to improve his yields and income and to continue sending his children to school until they finish their studies in college. 

He is asking for an additional capital of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs required in transplanting rice. Despite the hardships and difficulties he encountered in farming, he has the strong determination to maintain a high production. He hopes that someday he will improve their status of living and becomes financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay labor costs required in transplanting rice

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 37 years of age, a father of two children. He is engaged in small eatery business. Together with his wife, he makes breakfast, lunch and snacks, such as pancit and soup, which are affordable to his customers. He offers a variety of items on his menu to have a lot of choices and to attract customers as well.

He has already been operating this activity for over one year and is very much thankful for the improvement of their living situation that his business brings to them. He wants to generate more income for the development of his business and save for the education of his children. So Ronald is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase meats, vegetables, rice and essential ingredients (oil, salt, and vinegar) of cooking.

He hopes that these goods bring additional revenue for the betterment of his family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables, rice and essential ingredients (oil, salt, and vinegar) of cooking

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 52 years old and married to Domingo. She is a hardworking woman. She has two grown children. Josie is from the village of Bagong Silang from the province of Isabela. Josie engages in fattening pigs. She is asking for a loan amounting to 6,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that someday she can meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Romill

texts.en:
Romill is 21 years old and still single. Due to the lack of job opportunities, he engages in rice farming to earn income. He plans to earn and save more income to help his parents in financing the education of his younger brothers and to build his own house before he gets married. 

He planned to expand his rice plantation to increase his yields, but due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in the rice farming business. He believes that this loan will help him to work out his plan and make an improvement in his business. He hopes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in the rice farming business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old and lives with her husband and one child. She has a stall where she sells variety of accessories. She is a friendly and enduring woman. People are looking for her and her products because she offers very affordable, yet high quality items. This causes an increase in demand for her.

She is a woman who has many goals in life. Raquel wants to grow her business, finish her children’s education and improve their living situation. To accomplish all of her dreams, she is requesting a loan 25,000 PHP to purchase cell phone accessories, hangers, clippers, beepers and toys as additional products to offer. 

She is very determined to be successful. So with her tirelessly working in her business everyday and having faith in God, she will soon be able to achieve financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone accessories, hanger, clippers, beepers and toys as additional products to offer

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a hardworking mother who supports her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high production. They have two children who are now studying at the college level. Alfreda and her husband want them to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. Despite the hardships in farming, this couple has the determination to improve their status of living and give their children a better life. 

Alfreda is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs required for transplanting rice. They are hoping that they will increase their production and income to support their children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 54 years old, is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and children. She has a stall in the market where she offers Xerox copies. She is supported by her family in operating this business. Despite her age, Norma endures working for the enhancement of the family's living situation.

To continue her business, Norma is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase bond paper, a drum kit, dispersant, ink and a Xerox copier lamp both for maintenance and to sell. She hopes to earn higher profits through her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase bond paper, a drum kit, dispersant, ink and a Xerox copier lamp

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, 40 years old, is married and has three children. She has worked in the market selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years and it has been a great help in supporting the family's everyday lives. Leticia wants to invest in her business to earn higher than her usual income for her children’s education.

Leticia decided to ask for financial assistance from Alalay sa kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. to boost her income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional goods to offer, such as grapes, apples, eggplants, onions and cucumbers. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she will be able to save and provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Allain Gei

texts.en:
Determination and patience have been Allain Gei's characteristics during his eight years of operation of his 1.2 hectares of rice field. He is 25 years of age and happily married. He is thankful that he is blessed with two healthy children.

Allain Gei devotes his time to cultivating his rice field to improve the soil and growth of his rice crop. He has been doing his very best to improve their way of living and save some money for the education of his children. Though his generated income has increased, it's still not sufficient for his family due to the high cost of basic necessities and the abrupt increase in the price of farm supplies.

With this situation, Allain Gei is encouraged to borrow additional capital from the lenders to obtain his goal for his family. So, he is requesting a loan in the amount of P15,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides for his rice field. He hopes that his requested loan will be of great help in improving his farming business. Allain Gei knows that his dreams will be fulfilled through continued financial support by the lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer  and insecticides for his rice field.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo was born in 1963 and raised by his parents, who were farmers. Due to financial limitations he was not be able to finish his education, and has been in the farming business since he was 16.

Now, at the age 46, Domingo is married and owns a plot of inherited land upon which he grows rice. He and his wife work unstintingly in order to make a good profit. He is now requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy essential farming inputs such as rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

Domingo hopes to produce abundant crops in the next season to gain a higher income to better provide for his family’s necessities.

loans.use: to buy essential inputs in farming such as rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a diligent wife. She is widowed and operates a retail store to generate an income. She is selling grocery items such as biscuits, sugar, coffee, milk and shampoo to her neighborhood. She has been operating it for 3 years now. 

She would like to develop her retail business to earn additional income. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to increase the grocery items she offers. She will buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, breads and eggs to sell in her store. 

Teodora would like to keep earning funds for the education of her three children and assure them a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, breads and eggs to sell in her store

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en: Rodel is 29 years old and single. He lives with his parents at Enrile. He was not able to finish his college education, so he just got involved in a retail business to earn an income. He helps his parents acquire income for daily meals. He is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods and eggs to sell in his store. He would like to keep generating good income from it and someday establish a larger store for additional income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and eggs to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to use in cooking food

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Farming has been the primary source of income for Gloria's family. She is 57 years old and married to Dominador, Sr. The couple are blessed with five children. Four of them are married and living separately with their own families while the youngest is still single and working.

Gloria owns and manages her farmland: one and half hectares of rice and one hectare of corn .She started her rice farming in 2004 and in 1986, her corn farm. According to her, the income generated from her farming was used for the education of her children during their school days.

So Gloria is requesting additional capital because her income is no longer enough due to her other obligations to her children and other household expenses. Gloria is asking for P15,000 which will be used to buy farm inputs to improve the soil and growth of her rice crop so that she can obtain greater profit next crop season. In this way, she can earn a bigger income which will enable her to improve their living conditions and save some for her security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a patient mother. She lives at Solana with her spouse and five young children. To generate an income, her spouse raises crops while she is involved in hog raising. Together, they generate an income for the education of their children. 

She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy vitamins, medicines and hog feed for sustainability. She would like to continuously earn good profits for her children's education so they earn a degree someday.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicines and hog feed for sustainability.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 45 years old, married and blessed with four children. He is in the business of farming and in need of a loan of 10,000 pesos to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pay the labor cost for workers. He decided to access a loan for the improvement of their primary source of income and in order to harvest more crops without delinquencies. 


He hopes for the success of his business through his hard work and his loan as well, so that it will brings a betterment of their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pay for the labor cost for workers.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en:
Hog-raising is Dionicia's primary source of income. For three years now, she has been raising hogs for future sale. She is now raising two pigs. 

Dionicia is 35 years old and married to a farmer. Together, they educate two children. She is borrowing 9,000 PHP to buy hog feed and medicines to ensure her hogs' growth and nutrition.

Dionicia would like to further develop the family's businesses so that someday they will alleviate their family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines

loans.name: Neri

texts.en:
Neri has managed her retail store for two years. She is married to Randy and they have been blessed with three children who are school-aged. She is glad because her husband is supportive in her decisions for her business improvement.

Neri would like to increase the volume of her merchandise, but the capital she has generated from the business is not enough. This is due to the increased  household expenses, school fees and allowances of her children. So, Neri is asking for a loan amounting to P30,000. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted, so that she could attain her goal and support her childrens' education. This loan amount would really help her to uplift their lifestyle from poverty and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Remigildo

texts.en:
Remigildo is 31 years old, married to Lucia and has one child. He provides for his family through his farming business. His wife also helps him in developing their lifestyle with the piggery business she operates.

He would like his wife to be able to stop working because he sees it is difficult for her, so he needs to work hard to increase their income. With his determination to increase his proceeds every harvesting season, he asked for a loan of 10,000PHP to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides that are commonly used for crops.

These supplies would a great help in increasing the family income and allowing him to invest money for the future of his child and the children that are on the way.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides that are commonly used for crops.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 31 years old and has been growing rice for five years. His greatest business challenges are the pests that invade his crop and decrease his income. He was not able to purchase insecticides for his rice crop, which made it prone to insects. He already knows his lesson. To avoid what he suffered and fight such an infestation in the future, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and most especially insecticides.

Hopefully it will not happen again so that they can move ahead with their production, enabling him to increase his income and provide better financial support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is business-oriented person. She is 57 years old and happily married to Santos. The couple were blessed with three children. All of her children are married already.

Rebecca is glad because she has been able to manage her farming business for almost ten years. Farming was the primary source of income of the family before but as days passed, she has been able to improve on it. Nowadays, she has an established variety store that she started operating in 2003 while in 2005 she began her direct selling business. According to her, the income generated from her variety store was utilized to restock her store alone because she is aiming to obtain greater profit.

Rebecca would like to ask for additional capital because her income from her agriculture business is no longer enough due to the increase in the price of farm supplies. So,she is asking for financial assistance amounting to P15,000. She will be using this amount to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for her rice field improvement. She hopes that her rice crop will grow and be healthy so she can have good yields this next crop season. 

Rebecca believes that her success relies on her ability to manage all her businesses wisely.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for farming business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 32 years old, married, and thankful because he has been blessed with two children. He has been a farmer for almost eight years. He usually plants and harvests rice to sell. His ambition in life is to improve the status of living for his family and to give his children the best education possible. Sometimes, there are problems they come across, but through their strong determination, they can survive. 

Eduardo aims to cultivate 1.5 hectares of farmland to plant more rice. But he lacks the necessary capital, and thus he wants to access a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, rice seeds and to pay the labor costs required to plant rice. He believes that this loan will help him to make growth in his business. He is hoping that he will have a plenteous harvest to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, rice seeds and to pay the labor costs required to plant rice.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 47 years old. He is married to Michaela and has two children. He has been involved in the farming business for 25 years. He has three hectares of land where he grows rice. He sells his harvest to traders and earned about 50,000 PHP last crop season. The income will then help him to cope with the needs of his family and give his children a better education. 

Robert wants to obtain a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further the growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is a 47-year-old married woman. She is currently residing at Daburab, Cauayan City. 

Benilda and her husband operate a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been seven years in this business. Every crop season, she earns 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.
