Right now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm inputs such as rice seedlings, insecticides and pesticides to sustain her rice farm. She believes that this loan will be an enormous help for them  and increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, insecticides and pesticides to sustain her rice farm.

loans.name: Cornelio Nelson

texts.en:
Cornelio Nelson is a married man from the town of Cauayan City in the province of Isabela. He and his wife have both been farmers for twenty years. They primarily grow rice to sell. Cornelio Nelson does his best to improve their business and take care of their three school-aged children.

At this time, Cornelio Nelson is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en: Orlino, 27 years old, is still single and lives with his parents. He is a local farmer in Barangay Dabburab, Cauayan City. Orlino manages 1.5 hectares of rice. He is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 in order to fulfill all his farming needs. such as enough supplies of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides, along with his needs for manpower to make his farming easier and more productive. Orlino tries his best to overcome different problems that come along in his life.

loans.use: to fulfill all his farming needs (seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides)

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
In the year 1996, Joel started to manage their rice field.  He is 40 years old and is married with four children. He plants and harvests rice for sale. His wife is engaged in a hog-raising business for their additional income. They work hard to give their children a good quality of life. 

He would like to expand his rice plantation, but he has inadequate capital. Therefore, Joel is asking for additional capital in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy rice seed, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs required to plant rice. He believes that this loan will help him improve the business, and he hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay the labor costs required to plant rice.

loans.name: Gomer

texts.en:
Gomer is 34 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He works in agriculture, particularly in the farming business to support his family. He has been planting rice for five years and feels dissatisfaction with his income due to the high cost of farm supplies needed in farming, as well as commodities and allowances for his children.


To sustain the needs of his family without insufficiency he should double his patience in working in order to harvest a lot of crops. He decided to ask for a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital to use to maintain his business. He would use the money to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.
 

With the help of the loan, he will soon recognize the benefits of his hard work and be satisfied with the outcome of his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira’s favorite quotation is “she works to live not she live to work”. Elvira is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer working in the Philippines.

Elvira is engaged in selling fragrances and other cosmetic products like makeup, lipstick and lotions. Elvira’s goal in life is to uplift their living and not encounter financial shortages. To smoothly attain her goal, Elvira also engages herself in a hog raising business for an additional source of income for the family.

Elvira is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She will look towards the success of her present business and whatever business she may have.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years of age and married to Arturo who is a farmer. She and her husband work together to provide their living.The couple is living within the local community of Villamor Cabarroguis. Gloria has been blessed with six children but four of them are married; another one is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) and the youngest is still studying.

Gloria runs and has owned her rice field for three years. She planned to increase her rice production to earn a higher income but due to price of farm supplies, her income is no longer sufficient. In this regard, she is requesting additional capital in the amount of P15,000. She will be using her requested loan in buying farm supplies and to pay for labor costs for transplanting her rice field. Gloria believes that through her patience and perseverance she can obtain fruitful outcome for her yields this next crop season.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor for transplanting  rice plants.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a proud farmer living in Peñablanca with his spouse and three children. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn his income. He has been doing this for over five years and earns approximately P10,000.

He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers to use in farming.

He wants to keep making the business profitable to lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a responsible wife who helps her spouse generate an income. Together, they plant and harvest corn to sell. With the income in this kind of business they are able to cover the daily meals and allowances of their two children. Edna is now asking for a loan to make improvements on her output. She is asking for loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and corn seeds to grow.

Hopefully, she can earn consistent profits for her children's education and for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and corn seeds to grow.

loans.name: Langga

texts.en:
Langga is 40 years old, married and a farmer living in Peñablanca. He has been in the farming business, planting and harvesting maize/corn for future sale, for almost 10 years. He still aspires to improve his output, so he is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

In the future, he would like to make his crop productive every harvest season, for him to earn more profits for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as maize/corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 46 years old and blessed with three children. He supports his family through his farm. He manages a half-hectare rice field. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to have additional working capital. This loan will help to continue with his business so that it can become more profitable. 

He wants to send all his children to school and for them to get degrees so that they will not be like him, who suffers a lot in order to provide for their basic needs. He has promised to himself that he will do everything he can for the welfare of his children.

loans.use: to have additional working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase  winter clothes in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita manages her three-hectare rice field and her one-hectare corn farm. She is 44 years of age and married with two children.

Jovita has been running her rice and corn fields for almost 21 years. She is aiming to increase her yields this next crop season because their household expenses are increasing and so are the allowances of her children. Despite her difficulties on the farm, she still endures all those things in order to obtain a higher income.

With her determination to improve her rice production, she is applying for a loan of PHP 20,000. She intends to use her requested loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, corn seeds, herbicides and insecticides. Some will be used to pay for the labor cost of  hired laborers to plant her farmland. Jovita hopes that she can make her farming business more profitable so that she can let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seeds, herbicides, and insecticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie believes that facing the future is not easy. Lennie is 24 years of age, married, and has one child. Lennie has been managing her sari-sari (variety) store business for over five years. She usually sells spices, snack foods, beverages and noodles.

Lennie wish to expand the business thru extending the range of products she sells in their village. That’s why she is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy additional items to sell like eggs, coffee, milk and sugar. Lennie hopes to continue to operate the business and meet the demands of her customers and create good service for them.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, coffee, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en: Baker is a 26-year-old single man. He is a worker in a coffee shop with a very decent salary, and he has a stall for selling used home appliances, but also not enough to cover his needs and daily expenses, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing more used home appliances to resell. This will increase sales and improve Baker's income. Baker is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase used home appliances to resell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline runs a tailoring business which is located inside her house. She has had this kind of business since 2003 after her marriage. She is 35 years of age and married with three children. Two of her children are studying while the youngest is still an infant. 

Evangeline and her husband Arnold have been doing their best to support their family needs. Her husband works as truck driver within their local community of Villamor Cabarroguis. She would like to buy additional fabrics and thread due to the many orders that come to her but the capital allotted for the business is not enough due to high cost of commodities. 

So she would like to take out a loan amounting to P15,000. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can save some funds for the bright future of her children and improve the financial status of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for her  tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in her village

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene engages in farming, which involves planting and harvesting rice in her field within her village. Irene manages her one hectare of rice. She is helped by her husband in managing their farm. 

Irene is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Farming is the main source of income of her family. She successfully sends her children to school through the profit she gained from farming. That’s why Irene is proud to share that she and her husband are farmers.

Irene wishes that she could borrow a loan that has a minimal interest rate. She chooses our organization because she believes that it will help her to finance her farming needs. Irene decided to borrow a loan of P27,000 to purchase rice seeds to grow and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 27-year-old man and is married with two sons. He is a construction worker and his wife is a school teacher, and both have decent salaries, but not enough to cover the family's needs. Fadi's wife wants to get a new computer at home to help her do exercises and search for different topics related to her work. Fadi is requesting a 1,100 USD loan from FATEN to help his wife cover the costs of purchasing a new computer. This will improve Fadi's wife's teaching skills and create a better life and work conditions for her. Fadi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
At his age, Roman is getting old. He is 59 years old, married, and has five adult-age children. Roman’s wife is a housekeeper. His goal is maintaining his crop's good quality and sell them at a good price.

Roman manages his rice farming business. He has been in this business for 40 years. He is happy to share that through farming, he sustained his family's needs. That’s why even though he is getting old, Roman continues working in his farm.

With the high cost of farm inputs at this time, Roman is asking for a loan of P27,000 to buy farm inputs needed in rice farming like fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. Roman hopes to maintain the business until he has the energy to do farm activities.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed in rice farming like fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 44-year-old mother of two children, married to Bruno. Her family is currently living in Villamor Cabarroguis. The village where they live is an agricultural community, where the main source of income for most of the residents comes from rice and corn farming. Her husband is in charge of cultivating their 3.5 hectares of rice fields.

Luisa would like to help her husband provide income to meet the needs of the family, so she patiently runs her hog raising business. She is raising two sows and fattening two to obtain extra income for the education of her two children. She has had this kind of business for almost 15 years. According to her, having a college student results in many expenses due to tuition fees, allowances, and room and board. Though she suffers from hardships and shortages in financial matters; still, she endures it because her main goal is to let her children finish their degree courses. For this reason, Luisa is asking for financial assistance amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be used to buy feed and vaccine needed to raise her hogs. She knows that her sacrifices will lead her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine needed for her hog raising business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie has operated her hog raising business for almost 20 years. She currently raises two piglets and one boar. She is glad because her husband helps her raise the hogs.

Rosemarie, 60 years old, is married and has eight children. With the large size of their household, she and her husband double their time in managing their own businesses. While she is busy feeding her hogs, Rosemarie's husband is also busy cultivating and tending their rice field so that they can have a plentiful harvest next crop season. Though four of her children are married, Rosemarie still aims to increase her income to educate her younger children.

Rosemarie is looking forward to her business' success in the future. To make her dreams come true, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes that this amount will help her improve her business continually, which would allow her to save some money for emergency purposes when she and her husband get weak.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo always wishes for a better way of living for his family. He strives to bestow their needs. Leo, 32 years old, is married and blessed with two school-aged children. Leo’s priority in life is to prepare for his children's education.

Leo has operated a rice farming business since he got married. His wife is a housekeeper. Leo’s goal in every crop is to get a high yield and to earn profit to support his family's needs. Leo is seldom seen in their village going to neighbors and having fun. You can see him instead on his farm every day visiting his crops to assure that they are in good condition.

Leo is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and herbicides for plant care. Leo believes that applying the required fertilizers on his crops will give him a better yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila, 45 years old, is married and the mother of two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a Ministry of Education employee with a decent salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Leila has a cultural center where she gives private lessons to students. She wants to improve her center by purchasing new computers for the students who come to the center to use to improve their skills. Leila doesn't have enough money to pay for the computers, so she is requesting a $3,000 US loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new computers and improving the center. This will increase Leila's income and improve the family's living conditions. Leila is a conservative woman, so her husband Anwar is photographed instead in her cultural center.

loans.use: To purchase new computers for her cultural center

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 33-year-old single young man. He is an employee in a private company with a decent salary, which is not enough, however, to cover his needs. Mahmoud wants to help his brother cover his wedding expenses, such as purchasing home furniture and appliances, etc. Mahmoud is requesting a $2,000 US loan from FATEN to help his brother cover the wedding expenses. This will allow his brother to enjoy his wedding day and provide him with better life conditions.

loans.use: To pay for wedding expenses

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda et a 38 ans. Il est marie avec 4 enfants de 9 mois à 12  ans, dont 2 scolarises.il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des marchandises de  boutique (4 sacs de  sucre, 10kgs de miel, jus, huile de cuisine, des mayonnaise etc.…)

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir son stock pour pouvoir satisfaire ses marchés. Emmanuel voudrait être un grand commerçant en matière d’alimentation, donc d’avoir un jour l’alimentation (supermarket). Avec le profit  Emmanuel voudrait scolarise ses enfants  et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda and is 38 years old.  He is married with four children from 9 months to 12 years old, two of whom are in school; he also has one other person in his care besides his children.  He has three years of secondary education.

Emmanuel is a shopkeeper.  This is his second loan with ACB.  He is going to buy food products for sale (4 bags of sugar, 10 kg of honey, juice, cooking oil, mayonnaise, etc.).

His business growth strategy is to increase his inventory to better satisfy his markets.  Emmanuel would like to be a large-scale food seller and to one day have a supermarket.  With the profits, he would like to pay for his children's schooling and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy food products (4 bags of sugar, 10 kg of honey, juice, cooking oil, mayonnaise, etc.).

loans.name: Jyambere/makoro Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste fait partie du groupe Jyambere makoro. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de pomme de terre. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture et cherche le marche pour ses produits. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait  un jour être le grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’avoir sa propre maison, de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste, age 28, is a member of Jyambere / makoro Group. He's married and has two children, age 3 and 6. One of them attends school. His own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Jean Baptiste is a potato cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, to be used to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers, and pay for workforce.

His strategy for growing his business is to modernize his farming practices, and to look for markets for his products. In the forthcoming years, he would like to become a big merchant.

With his profits, he intends to get his own house, send his children to school, and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers, and pay for workforce

loans.name: Twitezimbere/gsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Gsz. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 5 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Pierre est cultivateur de pomme de terre. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture et cherche le marche pour ses produits. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Pierre voudrait être le grand agri-éleveur et être le distributeur des produits agricoles. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Pierre is a member of the Twitezimbere/Gsz Group.  He is 28 years old, married, with four children ranging between 5 and 9 years old.  Two of his children attend school.  Jean Pierre completed six years of primary school. He is a potato farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy potato seeds, chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor.  His strategy to promote the growth of his business is to modernize his agriculture and to seek a market for his crops.  In the coming years Jean Pierre would like to be a great farmer-producer and a distributor of agricultural products.  With the profits, he is planning to send his children to school and improve their well-being.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
At age 54 in San Vicente, a community located in the outskirts of Tumuini, Maximo has been working as a farmer for 35 years. He grows crops, including vegetables. He is a happily married man.

When he started out farming, it was on a piece of land the government assigned to him, and, since then, he’s worked his parcel proudly with much effort and hard work, generating food for his children. He travels to the town of Tumuini to sell his crops, looking to sell them at a good price in the market. Competition is intense, but he strives until he accomplishes the sale. He returns home with the satisfaction of having gotten a good price for his products.

He is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business. The loan will help him to buy the necessary supplies to produce a good-quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the village of San Vicente in Isabela Province. Janet grows corn and rice.

Janet is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for five years. She buys her supplies in her town and sells her products in the market in the same place.

Janet will use the loan that she requested to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow corn and rice. The loan will help her to increase her income, which means she will be able to help her family and to invest. Her dream is to finish the construction of her own home.

In her free time, Janet enjoys resting and walking in their community.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates the land. Domingo is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His current income is not enough to sustain the family properly.

Domingo would like to develop his agriculture business and get more income. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase fertilizer and corn seeds.

This loan will help Domingo to earn additional income to pay for his children's education and to ensure a sustainable future for them.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old and lives with her husband in the village of San Vicente, an agricultural area with corn, rice, and different vegetables. Carmen has four children.

Carmen is a housewife who also participates in agriculture. She is asking for a loan to invest in corn and rice seeds and to buy fertilizer. With the help of the loan she will have a better financial standing.

Carmen's dream is to renovate her house to be more comfortable for her family. She has not been presented with any problems. In her free time, she likes to watch television.

With her previous loan, she invested in agriculture. Her family circumstances have improved, and her earnings have been evident because she can contribute to the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en: Angelito is a humble man who is 30 years of age. He has two grown up children and is married to Vesusa. He is a farmer in the San Vicente province of Isabela. His plan for his family is to improve their quality of life. He’s been a farmer for a long time. He’s very happy with the support he gets from Kiva funds because he was able to use the loan amounting PHP 35,000 to plant larger areas of corn and rice crops as well as to fertilize a great part of the established plants which led to very satisfactory results. His greatest dream is to be able to finish his house to enjoy greater well being.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is a 34-year-old man who engages in farming and has four years of experience in this field. Dominador is married and has two children.  He raises and sells corn, rice and vegetables, and his cropping income from this business is PHP 20,000. 

Dominador applied for this PHP 25,000 loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Dominador has a good client history

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en: Sotero is a 54-year-old Filipino man who lives with his wife and five school-age children. There is no doubt that he has a huge responsibility as the main source of income for his large family. Sotero has owned a plot of land in his town since 2005. He cultivates rice and corn. Today, he is asking to borrow 40,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva's partner to purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticides and tools to prepare the land for crops. In the future, he plans to use advanced farming techniques and methods in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business

loans.name: Jofeline

texts.en:
Jofeline is 38 years old, and lives with her family including her husband and two children.  She is a woman who remains lively and innovative. She has worked throughout her life to give her family a good quality of life. The fact is, she opened a store in their home offering a variety of basic needs six years ago. She works hard for her business.

She realizes that the most important thing in the business is customers because they are the lifeblood of business. She always tries to give the best service for them in order to gain the lead over her competitors. And to make it possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, sweet bread, coffee, drinks, candies, detergent and other items that are attractive to her customers. This way, she hopes to enhance the quality of life of her family which is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, sweet bread, and other items that are attractive.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: At the age of 53, Celia still strives hard to earn an income. She has a retail store and saves profits from it for the daily meals of the family. She had two grown up children with their own employment, but she does not want to rely on their remittances. As of now, Celia wants to increase her income so she is asking for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, milk, coffee and sugar to sell in her small store. With her patience and hard work, she is confident that someday they can achieve a successful life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, coffee and sugar to sell in her small store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita had an early marriage. At the age of 28, she already has two children. She is married to Edgardo, a tricycle operator in their village. The daily income from the business goes for meals, school expenses and allowances for her children. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to pay for a driver's license renewal and to buy side mirrors for the motorcycle. Anita hopes that her spouse can safely provide motorcycle transport services daily and finally achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to pay for a driver's license renewal and buy side mirrors for the motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is well known to be a patient and helpful mother. She is married to a farmer; thus, helps her spouse with farming activities such as planting and harvesting corn to sell. They are able to provide sustenance to the family through farming. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. She promises to repay her loan on time, and, hopefully, she can make her crop more profitable to save profits for her family's future expenses and the college education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in Rang-ay, Cabatuan, where he manages their rice field. He has been farming for ten years. He made 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) with his last crop. He is thankful because the income he generates from his business helps to provide for the family's daily needs and allows him to continue sending his children to school. Now, Noel is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested, and he is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She's been growing rice and corn for the last seven years. In the agricultural sector in their village  rice and corn are very popular products. Mary Ann usually sells her crops in the market as well as to neighbors. Now Mary Ann wants to increase the amount she sells. She needs additional capital of P 25,000 to invest in her business to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farm business.
